original: Kathaṁ sotāvadhāne paññā sutamaye ñāṇaṁ?🔽“Ime dhammā abhiññeyyā”ti sotāvadhānaṁ, taṁpajānanā paññā sutamaye ñāṇaṁ.
analyzed: katham sotāvadhāne paññā suta maye ñāṇa  ime dhammā sotāvadhāna tapa jānanā paññā suta maye ñāṇa
translated: How is it that understanding of giving ear is knowledge resulting from learning?🔽Giving ear thus: ‘These ideas are to be fully known,’ is understanding of that as it actually is, knowledge resulting from learning.

original: “Ime dhammā pariññeyyā”ti sotāvadhānaṁ, taṁpajānanā paññā sutamaye ñāṇaṁ.🔽“Ime dhammā pahātabbā”ti sotāvadhānaṁ, taṁpajānanā paññā sutamaye ñāṇaṁ.🔽“Ime dhammā bhāvetabbā”ti sotāvadhānaṁ, taṁpajānanā paññā sutamaye ñāṇaṁ.
analyzed: ime dhammā pariññeyyā ti sotāvadhāna tapa jānanā paññā suta maye ñāṇa  ime dhammā pahātabbā ati sotāvadhāna tapa jānanā paññā suta maye ñāṇa  ime dhammā bhāvetabbā ati sotāvadhāna tapa jānanā paññā suta maye ñāṇa
translated: Giving ear thus: ‘These ideas are to be comprehended’ is understanding of that as it actually is, knowledge resulting from learning.🔽Giving ear thus: ‘These ideas are to be abandoned’ is understanding of that as it actually is, knowledge resulting from learning.🔽Giving ear thus: ‘These ideas are to be developed’ is understanding of that as it actually is, knowledge resulting from learning.

original: “Ime dhammā sacchikātabbā”ti sotāvadhānaṁ, taṁpajānanā paññā sutamaye ñāṇaṁ.🔽“Ime dhammā hānabhāgiyā”ti sotāvadhānaṁ, taṁpajānanā paññā sutamaye ñāṇaṁ.
analyzed: ime dhammā sacchikātabbā ati sotāvadhāna tapa jānanā paññā suta maye ñāṇa  ime dhammā hāna bhāgiyā ati sotāvadhāna tapa jānanā paññā suta maye ñāṇa
translated: Giving ear thus: ‘These ideas are to be realized’ is understanding of that as it actually is, knowledge resulting from learning.🔽Giving ear thus: ‘These ideas are on the side of decline’ is understanding of that as it actually is, knowledge resulting from learning.

original: “Ime dhammā ṭhitibhāgiyā”ti sotāvadhānaṁ, taṁpajānanā paññā sutamaye ñāṇaṁ.
analyzed: ime dhammā ṭhiti bhāgiyā ati sotāvadhāna tapa jānanā paññā suta maye ñāṇa
translated: Giving ear thus: ‘These ideas are on the side of stagnation’ is understanding of that as it actually is, knowledge resulting from learning.

original: “Ime dhammā visesabhāgiyā”ti sotāvadhānaṁ, taṁpajānanā paññā sutamaye ñāṇaṁ.
analyzed: ime dhammā visesa bhāgiyā ti sotāvadhāna tapa jānanā paññā suta maye ñāṇa
translated: “These ideas are on the side of distinction” is ear-work, the understanding that discerns that is knowledge of what is heard.

original: “Ime dhammā nibbedhabhāgiyā”ti sotāvadhānaṁ, taṁpajānanā paññā sutamaye ñāṇaṁ.🔽“Sabbe saṅkhārā aniccā”ti sotāvadhānaṁ, taṁpajānanā paññā sutamaye ñāṇaṁ.🔽“Sabbe saṅkhārā dukkhā”ti sotāvadhānaṁ, taṁpajānanā paññā sutamaye ñāṇaṁ.
analyzed: ime dhammā nibbedha bhāgiyā ati sotāvadhāna tapa jānanā paññā suta maye ñāṇa  sabbe saṅkhārāḥ aniccā ati sota avadhāna tapa jānanā paññā suta maye ñāṇa  sabbe saṅkhārā dukkhā ati sota avadhāna tapa jānanā paññā suta maye ñāṇa
translated: “These ideas are on the side of penetration” is ear-work, the understanding that discerns that is knowledge of what is heard.🔽“All determinations are impermanent” is ear-work, the understanding that discerns that is knowledge of what is heard.🔽“All determinations are painful” is ear-work, the understanding that discerns that is knowledge of what is heard.

original: “Sabbe dhammā anattā”ti sotāvadhānaṁ, taṁpajānanā paññā sutamaye ñāṇaṁ.🔽“Idaṁ dukkhaṁ ariyasaccan”ti sotāvadhānaṁ, taṁpajānanā paññā sutamaye ñāṇaṁ.🔽“Idaṁ dukkhasamudayaṁ ariyasaccan”ti sotāvadhānaṁ, taṁpajānanā paññā sutamaye ñāṇaṁ.
analyzed: sabbe dhammā anattā ati sotāvadhāna tapa jānanā paññā suta maye ñāṇa  idam dukkham ariya saccanti tapa jānanā paññā suta maye  idam dukkha samudayam ariya saccanti tapa jānanā paññā suta maye
translated: “All ideas are not self” is ear-work, the understanding that discerns that is knowledge of what is heard.🔽“This is the noble truth of suffering” is ear-work, the understanding that discerns that is knowledge of what is heard.🔽“This is the noble truth of the origin of suffering” is ear-work, the understanding that discerns that is knowledge of what is heard.

original: “Idaṁ dukkhanirodhaṁ ariyasaccan”ti sotāvadhānaṁ, taṁpajānanā paññā sutamaye ñāṇaṁ.
analyzed: idam dukkha nirodham ariya saccanti tapa jānanā paññā suta maye
translated: “This is the noble truth of the cessation of suffering” is ear-work, the understanding that discerns that is knowledge of what is heard.

original: “Idaṁ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā ariyasaccan”ti sotāvadhānaṁ, taṁpajānanā paññā sutamaye ñāṇaṁ.
analyzed: idam dukkha nirodha gāminī paṭipadā ariya saccanti tapa jānanā paññā suta maye ñāṇa
translated: ‘This is the noble truth of the practice leading to the cessation of suffering’ is applied thought. Understanding that is knowledge of what is heard.

original: Kathaṁ “ime dhammā abhiññeyyā”ti sotāvadhānaṁ, taṁpajānanā paññā sutamaye ñāṇaṁ?

original: Appavattaṁ nibbānanti abhiññeyyaṁ.🔽Animittaṁ nibbānanti abhiññeyyaṁ.🔽Anāyūhanā nibbānanti abhiññeyyaṁ.
analyzed: appavattam nibbānanti abhiññeyya  animittam nibbānanti abhiññeyya  anāyūhanā nibbānanti abhiññeyya
translated: Non-occurrence is Nibbāna.🔽The signless is Nibbāna.🔽Non-accumulation is Nibbāna.🔽Non-appearance is Nibbāna.

original: Appaṭisandhi nibbānanti abhiññeyyaṁ.🔽Agati nibbānanti abhiññeyyaṁ.🔽Anibbatti nibbānanti abhiññeyyaṁ.🔽Anupapatti nibbānanti abhiññeyyaṁ.
analyzed: appaṭisandhi nibbānanti abhiññeyya  agati nibbānanti abhiññeyya  anibbatti nibbānanti abhiññeyya  anupapatti nibbānanti abhiññeyya
translated: Non-destination is Nibbāna.🔽Non-manifestation is Nibbāna.🔽Non-rebirth is Nibbāna.

original: Ajāti nibbānanti abhiññeyyaṁ.🔽Ajaraṁ nibbānanti abhiññeyyaṁ.🔽Abyādhi nibbānanti abhiññeyyaṁ.
analyzed: ajāti nibbānanti abhiññeyya  ajaram nibbānanti abhiññeyya  abyādhi nibbānanti abhiññeyya
translated: Non-birth is Nibbāna.🔽Non-aging is Nibbāna.🔽Non-sickness is Nibbāna.

original: Amataṁ nibbānanti abhiññeyyaṁ.🔽Asoko nibbānanti abhiññeyyaṁ.🔽Aparidevo nibbānanti abhiññeyyaṁ.
analyzed: amatam nibbānanti abhiññeyya  asokaḥ nibbānan ti abhiññeyya  aparidevaḥ nibbānan ti abhiññeyya
translated: The deathless is Nibbāna.🔽Non-grief is Nibbāna.🔽Non-lamentation is Nibbāna.

original: Anupāyāso nibbānanti abhiññeyyaṁ. [15]🔽Uppādo saṅkhārā, anuppādo nibbānanti abhiññeyyaṁ.
analyzed: anupāyāsaḥ nibbānanti  uppādaḥ saṅkhārāḥ anuppādaḥ nibbānanti abhiññeyya
translated: Non-despair is Nibbāna.🔽Arising is a condition. Non-arising is Nibbāna.

analyzed: pavattam saṅkhārāḥ appavattam nibbānan ti abhiññeyya
translated: Occurrence is a condition. Non-occurrence is Nibbāna.

original: Nimittaṁ saṅkhārā, animittaṁ nibbānanti abhiññeyyaṁ.🔽Āyūhanā saṅkhārā, anāyūhanā nibbānanti abhiññeyyaṁ.
analyzed: nimittam saṅkhārāḥ animittam nibbānanti abhiññeyya  āyūhanā saṅkhārāḥ an āyūhanā nibbānanti abhiññeyya
translated: The sign is formations; the signless is Nibbāna.🔽Accumulation is formations; non-accumulation is Nibbāna.

original: Paṭisandhi saṅkhārā, appaṭisandhi nibbānanti abhiññeyyaṁ.🔽Gati saṅkhārā, agati nibbānanti abhiññeyyaṁ.🔽Nibbatti saṅkhārā, anibbatti nibbānanti abhiññeyyaṁ.🔽Upapatti saṅkhārā, anupapatti nibbānanti abhiññeyyaṁ.
analyzed: paṭisandhi saṅkhārāḥ appaṭisandhi nibbānanti abhiññeyya  gati saṅkhārāḥ agati nibbānanti abhiññeyya  nibbatti saṅkhārāḥ anibbatti nibbānanti abhiññeyya  upapatti saṅkhārāḥ anupapatti nibbānanti abhiññeyya
translated: Rebirth-linking is formations; non-rebirth-linking is Nibbāna.🔽Destiny is formations; non-destiny is Nibbāna.🔽Re-arising is formations; non-re-arising is Nibbāna.🔽Rebirth is formations; non-rebirth is Nibbāna.

original: Jāti saṅkhārā, ajāti nibbānanti abhiññeyyaṁ.🔽Jarā saṅkhārā, ajarā nibbānanti abhiññeyyaṁ.🔽Byādhi saṅkhārā, abyādhi nibbānanti abhiññeyyaṁ.
analyzed: jāti saṅkhārā ajāti nibbānanti abhiññeyya  jarā saṅkhārāḥ ajarā nibbānanti abhiññeyya  byādhi saṅkhārā abyādhi nibbānanti abhiññeyya
translated: Birth is formations; non-birth is Nibbāna.🔽Ageing is formations; non-ageing is Nibbāna.🔽Sickness is formations; non-sickness is Nibbāna.

original: Maraṇaṁ saṅkhārā, amataṁ nibbānanti abhiññeyyaṁ.🔽Soko saṅkhārā, asoko nibbānanti abhiññeyyaṁ.🔽Paridevo saṅkhārā, aparidevo nibbānanti abhiññeyyaṁ.
analyzed: maraṇam saṅkhārāḥ amatam nibbānanti abhiññeyya  sokaḥ saṅkhārāḥ asokaḥ nibbānanti abhiññeyya  paridevaḥ saṅkhārāḥ aparidevaḥ nibbānanti abhiññeyya
translated: Death is formations; deathlessness is Nibbāna.🔽Sorrow is formations; sorrowlessness is Nibbāna.🔽Lamentation is formations; non-lamentation is Nibbāna.

analyzed: upāyāsaḥ saṅkhārāḥ anupāyāsaḥ nibbānan ti
translated: Distress is formations; non-distress is Nibbāna.

analyzed: ubhovisuddhānam ajjhupekkhanaṭṭhaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ  visesa adhigama ṭṭhaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ
translated: The meaning of equanimity in the case of both purified minds is to be directly known.🔽The meaning of the attainment of distinction is to be directly known.

analyzed: uttari paṭivedha ṭṭhaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ

analyzed: sacca abhisamayaṭṭhaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ

analyzed: nirodhe patiṭṭhāpakaṭṭhaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ  saddhi indriyassa adhimokkha ṭṭhaḥ abhiññeyyo
translated: The meaning of establishment in cessation is to be directly known.🔽The meaning of resolution in the faith faculty is to be directly known.

analyzed: vīriya indriyassa paggaha ṭṭhaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ

analyzed: sati indriyassa upaṭṭhāna aṭṭhaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ

analyzed: samādhi indriyassa avikkhepa ṭṭhaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ
translated: The factor of concentration as a spiritual faculty should be directly known as non-distraction.

original: paññindriyassa dassanaṭṭho abhiññeyyo. [5]🔽Saddhābalassa assaddhiye akampiyaṭṭho abhiññeyyo;
analyzed: paññindriyassa dassanaṭṭhaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ  saddhā balassa a kampiya ṭṭhaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ
translated: The factor of wisdom as a spiritual faculty should be directly known as seeing.🔽The strength of faith should be directly known as unshakability regarding lack of faith.

original: vīriyabalassa kosajje akampiyaṭṭho abhiññeyyo;🔽satibalassa pamāde akampiyaṭṭho abhiññeyyo;

analyzed: samādhi balassa uddhacce akampiya ṭṭhaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ
translated: The strength of concentration should be directly known as unshakability regarding agitation.

original: paññābalassa avijjāya akampiyaṭṭho abhiññeyyo. [5]🔽Satisambojjhaṅgassa upaṭṭhānaṭṭho abhiññeyyo;
analyzed: paññā balassa avijjāya a kampiya ṭṭhaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ  sati sambojjhaṅgassa upaṭṭhāna ṭṭhaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ

analyzed: dhammavicaya sambojjhaṅgassa pavicaya ṭṭhaḥ abhiññeyyo
translated: The factor of complete awakening that is investigation of (the nature of) things should be directly known as the investigation of (the nature of) things.

original: vīriyasambojjhaṅgassa paggahaṭṭho abhiññeyyo;🔽pītisambojjhaṅgassa pharaṇaṭṭho abhiññeyyo;🔽passaddhisambojjhaṅgassa upasamaṭṭho abhiññeyyo;🔽samādhisambojjhaṅgassa avikkhepaṭṭho abhiññeyyo;
analyzed: vīriya sambojjhaṅgassa paggaha ṭṭhaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ  pīti sambojjhaṅgassa pharaṇa ṭṭhaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ  passaddhi sambojjhaṅgassa upasamaṭṭhaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ  samādhi sambojjhaṅgassa avikkhepa ṭṭhaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ
translated: The factor of complete awakening that is energy should be directly known as the exertion of energy.🔽The factor of complete awakening that is rapture should be directly known as the pervading of rapture.🔽The factor of complete awakening that is calm should be directly known as the calming down.

analyzed: upekkhā sambojjhaṅgassa paṭisaṅkhāna ṭṭhaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ
translated: The factor of complete awakening that is concentration should be directly known as non-distraction.🔽The factor of complete awakening that is equanimity should be directly known as the investigation (of things).

analyzed: sammādiṭṭhiyā dassana ṭṭhaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ

translated: The meaning of origination should be directly known in right action.🔽The meaning of cleansing should be directly known in right livelihood.

analyzed: sammāvāyāmassa paggahaṭṭhaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ  sammāsatiyāḥ upaṭṭhāna aṭṭhaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ
translated: The meaning of exertion should be directly known in right effort.🔽The meaning of establishment should be directly known in right mindfulness.

original: sammāsamādhissa avikkhepaṭṭho abhiññeyyo. [8]🔽Indriyānaṁ ādhipateyyaṭṭho abhiññeyyo;🔽balānaṁ akampiyaṭṭho abhiññeyyo;
analyzed: sammāsamādhissa avikkhepa ṭṭhaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ  indriyānam ādhipateyyaṭṭhaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ  balānam a kampiya ṭṭhaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ

original: pamāde akampiyaṭṭhena satibalaṁ abhiññeyyaṁ;🔽uddhacce akampiyaṭṭhena samādhibalaṁ abhiññeyyaṁ;
analyzed: pamāde a kampiya ṭṭhena sati balam  uddhacce a kampiya ṭṭhena samādhi balam
translated: the power of mindfulness should be directly known for its meaning of unshakability in negligence;🔽the power of concentration should be directly known for its meaning of unshakability in agitation;

original: avijjāya akampiyaṭṭhena paññābalaṁ abhiññeyyaṁ;🔽upaṭṭhānaṭṭhena satisambojjhaṅgo abhiññeyyo;
analyzed: avijjāya a kampiya ṭṭhena paññā balam  upaṭṭhāna ṭṭhena sati sambojjhaṅgaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ
translated: the power of wisdom should be directly known for its meaning of unshakability in ignorance.🔽The factor of Complete Awakening that is mindfulness should be directly known for its meaning of establishment;

original: pavicayaṭṭhena dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgo abhiññeyyo;🔽paggahaṭṭhena vīriyasambojjhaṅgo abhiññeyyo;🔽pharaṇaṭṭhena pītisambojjhaṅgo abhiññeyyo;
analyzed: pavicaya ṭṭhena dhammavicaya sambojjhaṅgaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ  paggaha aṭṭhena vīriya sambojjhaṅgaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ  pharaṇa ṭṭhena pīti sambojjhaṅgaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ
translated: the factor of Complete Awakening that is investigation of (the nature of) things should be directly known for its meaning of investigation;🔽the factor of Complete Awakening that is energy should be directly known for its meaning of exertion;🔽the factor of Complete Awakening that is rapture should be directly known for its meaning of pervading;

analyzed: upasama aṭṭhena passaddhi sambojjhaṅgaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ  avikkhepa ṭṭhena samādhi sambojjhaṅgaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ
translated: the factor of Complete Awakening that is calm should be directly known for its meaning of peace;🔽the factor of Complete Awakening that is concentration should be directly known for its meaning of non-distraction;

analyzed: paṭisaṅkhāna ṭṭhena upekkhā sambojjhaṅgaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ  dassana aṭṭhena sammādiṭṭhi abhiññeyyā
translated: the factor of Complete Awakening that is equanimity should be directly known for its meaning of reflection.🔽Right view should be directly known for its meaning of seeing;

original: abhiniropanaṭṭhena sammāsaṅkappo abhiññeyyo;🔽pariggahaṭṭhena sammāvācā abhiññeyyā;🔽samuṭṭhānaṭṭhena sammākammanto abhiññeyyo;
analyzed: abhiniropana ṭṭhena sammāsaṅkappaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ  pariggaha ṭṭhena sammāvācā abhiññeyyā  samuṭṭhāna ṭṭhena sammākammantaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ
translated: right thought should be directly known for its meaning of directing onto;🔽right speech should be directly known for its meaning of embracing;🔽right action should be directly known for its meaning of arising;

analyzed: vodāna aṭṭhena sammāājīvaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ
translated: right livelihood should be directly known for its meaning of purification;

analyzed: paggaha aṭṭhena sammāvāyāmaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ  upaṭṭhāna aṭṭhena sammā sati abhiññeyyā
translated: Right effort is to be directly known as the factor of maintaining.🔽Right mindfulness is to be directly known as the factor of establishing.

analyzed: avikkhepa aṭṭhena sammāsamādhi abhiññeyyaḥ  ādhipateyya ṭṭhena indriyā abhiññeyyā
translated: Right concentration is to be directly known as the factor of non-distraction.🔽The faculties are to be directly known as the factor of predominance.

analyzed: a kampiya ṭṭhena balā abhiññeyyā
translated: The powers are to be directly known as the factor of non-disturbance.

analyzed: niyyāna ṭṭhena bojjhaṅgā abhiññeyyā
translated: The factors of awakening are to be directly known as the factor of liberation.

original: hetuṭṭhena maggo abhiññeyyo;🔽upaṭṭhānaṭṭhena satipaṭṭhānā abhiññeyyā;🔽padahanaṭṭhena sammappadhānā abhiññeyyā;
analyzed: hetu ṭṭhena maggaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ  upaṭṭhāna ṭṭhena sati paṭṭhānā abhiññeyyā  padahana aṭṭhena sammappadhānā abhiññeyyā
translated: The path is to be directly known as the factor of cause.🔽The foundations of mindfulness are to be directly known as the factor of establishment.🔽The right efforts are to be directly known as the factor of exertion.

analyzed: ijjhana ṭṭhena iddhipādāḥ abhiññeyyā
translated: The bases of spiritual success are to be directly known as the factor of aspiration.

analyzed: tathaṭṭhena saccā abhiññeyyā  avikkhepa ṭṭhena samathaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ
translated: The truths are to be directly known as the factor of suchness.🔽Tranquillity is to be directly known as the factor of non-distraction.

analyzed: anupassana ṭṭhena vipassanā abhiññeyyā  ekarasa ṭṭhena samatha vipassanā abhiññeyyā
translated: Insight is to be directly known as the factor of contemplation.🔽Tranquillity and insight are to be directly known as having a single essence.

analyzed: an ativattana ṭṭhena yuga naddham abhiññeyya
translated: The twin-natures are to be directly known as the factor of non-excess.

analyzed: savaraṭṭhena sīla visuddhi abhiññeyyā
translated: Purification of virtue is to be directly known as the restraint.

analyzed: avikkhepa aṭṭhena citta visuddhi abhiññeyyā
translated: Purification of mind is to be directly known as the non-distraction.

analyzed: dassana aṭṭhena diṭṭhi visuddhi abhiññeyyā
translated: Purification of view is to be directly known as the seeing.

analyzed: mutta ṭṭhena vimokkhaḥ abhiññeyyaḥ
translated: Freedom is to be directly known as the meaning of release.

original: paṭivedhaṭṭhena vijjā abhiññeyyā;🔽pariccāgaṭṭhena vimutti abhiññeyyā;🔽samucchedaṭṭhena khaye ñāṇaṁ abhiññeyyaṁ;
analyzed: paṭivedha ṭṭhena vijjā abhiññeyyā  pariccāga ṭṭhena vimutti abhiññeyyā  samuccheda ṭṭhena khaye ñāṇam
translated: Clear knowing is to be directly known as the meaning of penetration.🔽Liberation is to be directly known as the meaning of relinquishment.🔽The knowledge of destruction is to be directly known as the meaning of cutting off.

analyzed: paṭippassaddha ṭṭhena anuppāde ñāṇam abhiññeyya
translated: The knowledge of non-arising is to be directly known as the meaning of peace.

analyzed: chandaḥ mūlaṭṭhena abhiññeyyaḥ  manasikāraḥ samuṭṭhāna ṭṭhena abhiññeyyaḥ
translated: Interest is to be directly known as the meaning of root.🔽Attention is to be directly known as the meaning of origination.

analyzed: phassaḥ samodhāna ṭṭhena abhiññeyyaḥ
translated: Contact is to be directly known as the meaning of meeting.

analyzed: vedanā samosaraṇa ṭṭhena abhiññeyyā  samādhi pamukha ṭṭhena abhiññeyyaḥ
translated: Feeling is to be directly known as the meaning of convergence.🔽Concentration is to be directly known as the meaning of forefront.

analyzed: sati ādhipateyya ṭṭhena abhiññeyyā
translated: Mindfulness is to be directly known as the meaning of mastery.

analyzed: paññā tad uttara ṭṭhena abhiññeyyā  vimutti sāraṭṭhena abhiññeyyā
translated: Wisdom is to be directly known as the meaning of what is higher.🔽Liberation is to be directly known as the meaning of heartwood.

original: amatogadhaṁ nibbānaṁ pariyosānaṭṭhena abhiññeyyaṁ. [9]🔽Ye ye dhammā abhiññātā honti te te dhammā ñātā honti.
analyzed: amatogadham nibbānam pariyosāna ṭṭhena abhiññeyya  ye ye dhammā abhiññātāḥ honti te te dhammā ñātāḥ honti
translated: Nibbana, the ultimate security, is to be directly known as the meaning of culmination.🔽Whatever qualities are directly known are known.🔽Knowing in the sense of that knowledge is wisdom in the sense of discernment.

analyzed: tañāta ṭṭhena ñāṇa pajānana ṭṭhena paññā 🔽tena vuccati
translated: This is the meaning of ‘wisdom is to be directly known’.

original: Yesaṁ yesaṁ dhammānaṁ paṭilābhatthāya vāyamantassa te te dhammā paṭiladdhā honti, evaṁ te dhammā pariññātā ceva honti tīritā ca.

analyzed: cattāro dhammā pahātabbā

analyzed: cha dhammā pahātabbā

analyzed: satta dhammā pahātabbā

analyzed: sattā anusayā

analyzed: aṭṭha dhammā pahātabbā

analyzed: aṭṭha micchattā

analyzed: nava dhammā pahātabbā
translated: Nine ideas to be abandoned:

analyzed: nava taṇhāmūlakā

analyzed: dasa dhammā pahātabbā
translated: Ten ideas to be abandoned:

analyzed: dasa micchattā
translated: ten wrongnesses.

analyzed: dve pahānāni
translated: Two kinds of abandoning:

analyzed: samuccheda pahāna paṭippassaddhi ppahāna
translated: abandoning by cutting off and abandoning by tranquillizing.

analyzed: samuccheda ppahānam ca lokuttaram khaya gāmi maggam bhāvayataḥ
translated: Abandoning by cutting off is for one who develops the supramundane path leading to the destruction of the defilements.

analyzed: paṭippassaddhi ppahānam ca phala khaṇe
translated: Abandoning by tranquillizing is at the moment of the fruition attainment.

analyzed: tīṇi pahānāni
translated: Three kinds of abandoning:🔽the escape from sensual desires is renunciation,

original: kāmānametaṁ nissaraṇaṁ yadidaṁ nekkhammaṁ;🔽rūpānametaṁ nissaraṇaṁ yadidaṁ āruppaṁ;
analyzed: kāmānam etam nissaraṇam yat idam nekkhamma  nissaraṇam yat idam āruppa
translated: the escape from forms is the formless,

original: yaṁ kho pana kiñci bhūtaṁ saṅkhataṁ paṭiccasamuppannaṁ, nirodho tassa nissaraṇaṁ.
analyzed: yam kho pana kiñci bhūtam saṅkhatam paṭiccasamuppanna nirodho tassa nissaraṇa
translated: and the escape from whatever is formed, has a beginning and an end, is subject to arising and passing away, is the unformed element.

original: Nekkhammaṁ paṭiladdhassa kāmā pahīnā ceva honti pariccattā ca.
analyzed: nekkhammam paṭiladdhassa kāmā pahīnā ca iva honti pariccattā ca
translated: When renunciation has been attained, sensual desires are abandoned and given up.

original: Āruppaṁ paṭiladdhassa rūpā pahīnā ceva honti pariccattā ca.
analyzed: āruppam paṭiladdhassa rūpā pahīnā ca iva honti pariccattā ca
translated: When the formless has been attained, forms are abandoned and given up.

original: Nirodhaṁ paṭiladdhassa saṅkhārā pahīnā ceva honti pariccattā ca.
analyzed: nirodham paṭiladdhassa saṅkhārā pahīnā ca iva honti pariccattā ca
translated: When he has attained cessation, formations are both abandoned and relinquished.

original: Cattāri pahānāni dukkhasaccaṁ pariññāpaṭivedhaṁ paṭivijjhanto pajahati;🔽samudayasaccaṁ pahānapaṭivedhaṁ paṭivijjhanto pajahati;🔽nirodhasaccaṁ sacchikiriyāpaṭivedhaṁ paṭivijjhanto pajahati;
analyzed: cattāri pahānāni dukkha saccam pariññā paṭivedham paṭivijjhantaḥ pajahati  samudaya saccam pahāna paṭivedham paṭivijjhantaḥ pajahati  nirodha saccam sacchikiriyā paṭivedham paṭivijjhantaḥ pajahati
translated: The four kinds of abandoning: when he penetrates the truth of suffering by the penetration of full understanding he abandons through the abandoning of what is to be fully understood;🔽when he penetrates the truth of origin by the penetration of abandoning he abandons through the abandoning of giving up;🔽when he penetrates the truth of cessation by the penetration of realizing he abandons through the abandoning of entering into;

analyzed: magga saccam bhāvanā paṭivedham paṭivijjhantaḥ pajahati
translated: when he penetrates the truth of the path by the penetration of developing he abandons through the abandoning of cultivation.

analyzed: pañca pahānāni
translated: The five kinds of abandoning:

original: vikkhambhanappahānaṁ, tadaṅgappahānaṁ, samucchedappahānaṁ, paṭippassaddhippahānaṁ, nissaraṇappahānaṁ.🔽Vikkhambhanappahānañca nīvaraṇānaṁ paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ bhāvayato;🔽tadaṅgappahānañca diṭṭhigatānaṁ nibbedhabhāgiyaṁ samādhiṁ bhāvayato;
analyzed: vikkhambhana ppahāna tad aṅga ppahāna samuccheda ppahāna paṭippassaddhi ppahāna nissaraṇa ppahāna  vikkhambhana pahānam ca nīvaraṇānam paṭhamam jhānam bhāvayataḥ  tad aṅga ppahānam ca diṭṭhi gatānam nibbedha bhāgiyam samādhim bhāvayato
translated: abandoning by suppression, abandoning by substitution of opposites, abandoning by cutting off, abandoning by tranquillization, abandoning by escape.🔽Abandoning by suppression: when he develops the first jhāna, he abandons the hindrances.🔽Abandoning by substitution of opposites: when he develops concentration that is a proximate cause of penetration, he abandons the false views.

analyzed: samuccheda ppahānam ca lokuttaram khaya gāmi maggam bhāvayataḥ
translated: Abandoning by cutting off: when he develops the supramundane path that leads to the destruction of the defilements, he abandons the fetters.

analyzed: paṭippassaddhi ppahānam ca phala khaṇe
translated: Abandoning by tranquillization: at the moment of fruition.

analyzed: nissaraṇa pahānam ca nirodhaḥ nibbāna
translated: Abandoning by escape: cessation, Nibbāna.

analyzed: sabba bhikkhave pahātabba
translated: “Monks, everything should be relinquished.

original: Kiñca, bhikkhave, sabbaṁ pahātabbaṁ?🔽Cakkhu, bhikkhave, pahātabbaṁ;
analyzed: kiñca bhikkhave sabbam  cakkhu bhikkhave pahātabba
translated: What should be relinquished?🔽The eye should be relinquished.

analyzed: rūpā pahātabbā  cakkhu viññāṇam
translated: Visual forms should be relinquished.🔽Eye-consciousness should be relinquished.

analyzed: cakkhu samphassaḥ pahātabbo
translated: Eye-contact should be relinquished.

original: yampidaṁ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṁ sukhaṁ vā dukkhaṁ vā adukkhamasukhaṁ vā, tampi pahātabbaṁ.
analyzed: yat pi idam cakkhu samphassa paccayā uppajjati vedayitam sukham vā dukkham vā adukkham asukham vā tat pi pahātabba
translated: Whatever feeling arises dependent on eye-contact—whether pleasant, painful, or neither-painful-nor-pleasant—that too should be relinquished.

analyzed: sotam  saddāḥ pahātabbā pe  ghānam
translated: The ear should be relinquished.🔽Sounds should be relinquished.🔽The nose should be relinquished.

analyzed: gandhā pahātabbā
translated: Smells should be relinquished.

analyzed: jivhā pahātabbā  rasā pahātabbā  kāyaḥ pahātabbo
translated: The tongue should be relinquished.🔽Flavors should be relinquished.🔽The body should be relinquished.

analyzed: phoṭṭhabbā pahātabbā  manaḥ pahātabbo  dhammā pahātabbā
translated: Tangibles should be relinquished.🔽The mind should be relinquished.🔽Ideas should be relinquished.

analyzed: manaḥ viññāṇam
translated: Mind-consciousness should be relinquished.

analyzed: manaḥ samphassaḥ pahātabbo
translated: Mind-contact should be relinquished.

original: yampidaṁ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṁ sukhaṁ vā dukkhaṁ vā adukkhamasukhaṁ vā, tampi pahātabbaṁ”.
analyzed: yat pi idam manaḥ samphassa paccayā uppajjati vedayitam sukham vā dukkham vā adukkham asukham vā tat pi
translated: Whatever feeling arises dependent on mind-contact—whether pleasant, painful, or neither-painful-nor-pleasant—that too should be relinquished.”

original: Rūpaṁ passanto pajahati, vedanaṁ passanto pajahati, saññaṁ passanto pajahati, saṅkhāre passanto pajahati, viññāṇaṁ passanto pajahati.
analyzed: rūpam passantaḥ pajahati vedanam passantaḥ pajahati saññam passantaḥ pajahati saṅkhāre passantaḥ pajahati viññāṇam passantaḥ pajahati
translated: Seeing form, he abandons it. Seeing feeling, seeing perception, seeing volitional formations, seeing consciousness, he abandons it.

analyzed: cakkhum pe
translated: Seeing the eye …

analyzed: jarā maraṇam pe
translated: Seeing aging-and-death …

analyzed: amatogadham nibbānam pariyosāna ṭṭhena passantaḥ pajahati
translated: seeing Nibbāna, the ultimate security, as the end, he abandons it.

original: Ye ye dhammā pahīnā honti te te dhammā pariccattā honti.
analyzed: ye ye dhammā pahīnāḥ honti te te dhammā pariccattāḥ honti
translated: Whatever states are abandoned are relinquished.

original: Taṁ ñātaṭṭhena ñāṇaṁ, pajānanaṭṭhena paññā.🔽Tena vuccati—
analyzed: tam ñāta ṭṭhena pajānana ṭṭhena paññā  tena vuccati
translated: That is knowledge as relinquishment. The discernment of that is wisdom.

original: “ime dhammā pahātabbāti sotāvadhānaṁ, taṁ pajānanā paññā sutamaye ñāṇan”ti. [3]
analyzed: ime dhammā pahātabbā ati pajānanā paññā suta maye ñāṇanti
translated: This is the “knowledge of what consists in the heard that is wisdom” in the sense of knowing that these things are to be abandoned.

analyzed: tatiya bhāṇavāraḥ
translated: The third recitation section.

original: Kathaṁ “ime dhammā bhāvetabbā”ti sotāvadhānaṁ, taṁpajānanā paññā sutamaye ñāṇaṁ?
analyzed: katham ime dhammā bhāvetabbā ati tapa jānanā paññā suta maye ñāṇa
translated: How is it that wisdom is knowledge of what consists in the heard in the sense of knowing that these things are to be developed?

analyzed: ekaḥ dhammaḥ bhāvetabbaḥ
translated: One thing is to be developed:

analyzed: kāya gatā asati sāta sahagatā
translated: mindfulness occupied with the body accompanied by enjoyment.

analyzed: dve dhammā bhāvetabbā
translated: Two things are to be developed:

analyzed: samathaḥ ca vipassanā ca
translated: tranquillity and insight.

analyzed: tayaḥ dhammā bhāvetabbā
translated: Three things are to be developed:

analyzed: tayoḥ samādhī
translated: the three concentrations.

analyzed: cattāraḥ dhammāḥ bhāvetabbā
translated: Four things are to be developed:

analyzed: cattāro sati paṭṭhānā
translated: the four establishments of mindfulness.

analyzed: pañca dhammā bhāvetabbā
translated: Five dhammas to be developed:

analyzed: pañcaṅgikaḥ samādhi
translated: the five factors of concentration.

analyzed: cha dhammā bhāvetabbā
translated: Six dhammas to be developed:

analyzed: cha anussati ṭṭhānāni
translated: the six recollections.

analyzed: satta dhammā bhāvetabbā
translated: Seven dhammas to be developed:

analyzed: satta bojjhaṅgā
translated: the seven factors of awakening.

analyzed: aṭṭha dhammā bhāvetabbā
translated: Eight dhammas to be developed:

analyzed: ariyaḥ aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggo
translated: the noble eightfold path.

analyzed: nava dhammā bhāvetabbā
translated: Nine dhammas to be developed:

analyzed: nava pārisuddhi padhāniyaṅgāni
translated: the nine factors of striving.

analyzed: dasa dhammā bhāvetabbā
translated: Ten dhammas to be developed:

analyzed: dasa kasiṇāyatanāni
translated: the ten kasiṇa bases.

analyzed: dve bhāvanā
translated: Two cultivations:

original: lokiyā ca bhāvanā, lokuttarā ca bhāvanā.
analyzed: lokiyā ca bhāvanā lokuttarā ca bhāvanā
translated: mundane cultivation and supramundane cultivation.

analyzed: tissaḥ bhāvanā
translated: Three cultivations:

original: rūpāvacarakusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ bhāvanā, arūpāvacarakusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ bhāvanā, apariyāpannakusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ bhāvanā.
analyzed: rūpāvacara kusalānam dhammānam bhāvanā arūpāvacara kusalānam dhammānam bhāvanā apariyāpanna kusalānam dhammānam bhāvanā
translated: the cultivation of wholesome thoughts in the form worlds, the cultivation of wholesome thoughts in the formless worlds, and the cultivation of wholesome thoughts that are not included in the worlds.

original: Rūpāvacarakusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ bhāvanā atthi hīnā, atthi majjhā, atthi paṇītā.
analyzed: rūpāvacara kusalānam dhammānam bhāvanā atthi hīnā atthi majjhā atthi paṇītā
translated: The cultivation of wholesome thoughts in the form worlds is either inferior, medium, or superior.

original: Arūpāvacarakusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ bhāvanā atthi hīnā, atthi majjhā, atthi paṇītā.🔽Apariyāpannakusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ bhāvanā paṇītā.
analyzed: arūpāvacara kusalānam dhammānam bhāvanā atthi hīnā atthi majjhā atthi paṇītā  a pariyāpanna kusalānam dhammānam bhāvanā paṇītā
translated: The cultivation of wholesome thoughts in the formless worlds is either inferior, medium, or superior.🔽The cultivation of wholesome thoughts that are not included in the worlds is superior.

analyzed: bhāvanā
translated: Four cultivations:

original: dukkhasaccaṁ pariññāpaṭivedhaṁ paṭivijjhanto bhāveti, samudayasaccaṁ pahānappaṭivedhaṁ
analyzed: dukkha saccam pariññā paṭivedham paṭivijjhantaḥ bhāveti samudaya saccam pahāna paṭivedha
translated: When penetrating the noble truth of suffering by the penetration of full understanding, he develops it. When penetrating the noble truth of the origin of suffering by the penetration of abandoning,🔽he develops it. When penetrating the noble truth of cessation of suffering by the penetration of realizing,

original: paṭivijjhanto bhāveti, nirodhasaccaṁ sacchikiriyāpaṭivedhaṁ paṭivijjhanto bhāveti,
analyzed: paṭivijjhantaḥ bhāveti nirodha saccam sacchikiriyā paṭivedham paṭivijjhantaḥ bhāveti
translated: he develops it. When penetrating the noble truth of the path by the penetration of developing,

analyzed: magga saccam bhāvanā paṭivedham paṭivijjhantaḥ bhāveti
translated: he develops it.

analyzed: imāḥ catassaḥ bhāvanāḥ
translated: These are the four developments.

analyzed: aparā api bhāvanā
translated: There are four more developments:

analyzed: esanā bhāvanā paṭilābha bhāvanā eka rasa bhāvanā āsevanā bhāvanā
translated: the development of seeking, the development of obtaining, the development of being of one taste, and the development of practice.

analyzed: katamā esanā bhāvanā
translated: What is the development of seeking?

original: Sabbesaṁ samādhiṁ samāpajjantānaṁ tattha jātā dhammā ekarasā hontīti—
analyzed: sabbesam samādhim samāpajjantānam tattha jātāḥ dhammāḥ ekarasāḥ honti iti
translated: When all those who attain concentration, the things arisen there are of one taste.

analyzed: ayam esanā bhāvanā
translated: This is the development of seeking.

analyzed: katamā paṭilābha bhāvanā
translated: What is the development of obtaining?

original: Sabbesaṁ samādhiṁ samāpannānaṁ tattha jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: sabbesam samādhim samāpannānam tattha jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When all those who have attained concentration, the things arisen there do not exceed each other.

analyzed: ayam paṭilābha bhāvanā
translated: This is the development of obtaining.

analyzed: katamā eka rasa bhāvanā
translated: What is the development of being of one taste?

original: Adhimokkhaṭṭhena saddhindriyaṁ bhāvayato saddhindriyassa vasena cattāri indriyāni ekarasā hontīti—
analyzed: adhimokkha ṭṭhena saddhi indriyam bhāvayato saddhi indriyassa vasena cattāri indriyāni ekarasā honti iti
translated: When one who is developing the faith faculty by way of resolution, the four faculties are of one taste by way of the faith faculty.

analyzed: bhāvanā
translated: The development of faculties is the unification of the faculties in the sense of having a single function.

original: Paggahaṭṭhena vīriyindriyaṁ bhāvayato vīriyindriyassa vasena cattāri indriyāni ekarasā hontīti—
analyzed: paggaha ṭṭhena vīriya indriyam bhāvayataḥ vīriya indriyassa vasena cattāri indriyāni ekarasā honti iti
translated: When he develops the energy faculty by exerting, the four faculties are unified under the heading of the energy faculty.

analyzed: bhāvanā
translated: The development of faculties is the unification of the faculties in the sense of having a single function.

original: Upaṭṭhānaṭṭhena satindriyaṁ bhāvayato satindriyassa vasena cattāri indriyāni ekarasā hontīti—
analyzed: upaṭṭhāna ṭṭhena sat indriyam bhāvayato sat indriyassa vasena cattāri indriyāni ekarasā honti iti
translated: When he develops the mindfulness faculty by being mindful, the four faculties are unified under the heading of the mindfulness faculty.

analyzed: bhāvanā
translated: The development of faculties is the unification of the faculties in the sense of having a single function.

original: Avikkhepaṭṭhena samādhindriyaṁ bhāvayato samādhindriyassa vasena cattāri indriyāni ekarasā hontīti—
analyzed: avikkhepa ṭṭhena samādhi indriyam bhāvayato samādhi indriyassa vasena cattāri indriyāni ekarasā honti iti
translated: When he develops the concentration faculty by concentrating, the four faculties are unified under the heading of the concentration faculty.

analyzed: bhāvanā
translated: The development of faculties is the unification of the faculties in the sense of having a single function.

original: Dassanaṭṭhena paññindriyaṁ bhāvayato paññindriyassa vasena cattāri indriyāni ekarasā hontīti—
analyzed: dassana ṭṭhena paññindriyam bhāvayato paññindriyassa vasena cattāri indriyāni ekarasā honti iti
translated: When he develops the understanding faculty by observing, the four faculties are unified under the heading of the understanding faculty.

original: indriyānaṁ ekarasaṭṭhena bhāvanā.🔽Assaddhiye akampiyaṭṭhena saddhābalaṁ bhāvayato saddhābalassa vasena cattāri balāni ekarasā hontīti—
analyzed: bhāvanā  assaddhiye akampiya ṭṭhena saddhā balam bhāvayato saddhā balassa vasena cattāri balāni ekarasā honti iti
translated: The development of faculties is the unification of the faculties in the sense of having a single function.🔽The development of the powers is the unification of the powers in the sense of having a single function.

analyzed: balānaṃ bhāvanā
translated: When he develops the faith power by being unshakeable about faith, the four powers are unified under the heading of the faith power.

original: Kosajje akampiyaṭṭhena vīriyabalaṁ bhāvayato vīriyabalassa vasena cattāri balāni ekarasā hontīti—
analyzed: kosajje akampiya ṭṭhena vīriya balam bhāvayato vīriya balassa vasena cattāri balāni ekarasā honti iti
translated: When he develops the energy faculty in the sense of unshakability in laziness, the four faculties have a single function in him in the sense of unshakability in laziness.

analyzed: balānaṃ bhāvanā
translated: So it is in this way that they are developed in the sense of a single function of the faculties.

original: Pamāde akampiyaṭṭhena satibalaṁ bhāvayato satibalassa vasena cattāri balāni ekarasā hontīti—
analyzed: pamāde akampiya ṭṭhena sati balam bhāvayato sati balassa vasena cattāri balāni ekarasā honti iti
translated: When he develops the mindfulness faculty in the sense of unshakability in negligence, the four faculties have a single function in him in the sense of unshakability in negligence.

analyzed: balānaṃ bhāvanā
translated: So it is in this way that they are developed in the sense of a single function of the faculties.

original: Uddhacce akampiyaṭṭhena samādhibalaṁ bhāvayato samādhibalassa vasena cattāri balāni ekarasā hontīti—
analyzed: uddhacce akampiya ṭṭhena samādhi balam bhāvayato samādhi balassa vasena cattāri balāni ekarasā honti iti
translated: When he develops the concentration faculty in the sense of unshakability in agitation, the four faculties have a single function in him in the sense of unshakability in agitation.

analyzed: balānaṃ bhāvanā
translated: So it is in this way that they are developed in the sense of a single function of the faculties.

original: Avijjāya akampiyaṭṭhena paññābalaṁ bhāvayato paññābalassa vasena cattāri balāni ekarasā hontīti—
analyzed: avijjāya akampiya ṭṭhena paññā balam bhāvayato paññā balassa vasena cattāri balāni ekarasā honti iti
translated: When he develops the understanding faculty in the sense of unshakability in ignorance, the four faculties have a single function in him in the sense of unshakability in ignorance.

original: balānaṁ ekarasaṭṭhena bhāvanā.🔽Upaṭṭhānaṭṭhena satisambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāvayato satisambojjhaṅgassa vasena cha bojjhaṅgā ekarasā hontīti—
analyzed: balānaṃ bhāvanā  upaṭṭhāna ṭṭhena sati sambojjhaṅgam bhāvayato sati sambojjhaṅgassa vasena cha bojjhaṅgāḥ ekarasāḥ honti iti
translated: So it is in this way that they are developed in the sense of a single function of the faculties.🔽When he develops the mindfulness enlightenment factor in the sense of establishing , the six enlightenment factors have a single function in him in the sense of establishing.

analyzed: bojjhaṅgānaṃ ekarasa ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: So it is in this way that they are developed in the sense of a single function of the enlightenment factors.

original: Pavicayaṭṭhena dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāvayato dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgassa vasena cha bojjhaṅgā ekarasā hontīti—
analyzed: pavicaya ṭṭhena dhammavicaya sambojjhaṅgam bhāvayataḥ dhammavicaya sambojjhaṅgassa vasena cha bojjhaṅgāḥ ekarasāḥ honti iti
translated: When he develops the enlightenment factor of discrimination of states by penetration he develops the seven enlightenment factors in such a way that they converge in the enlightenment factor of discrimination of states.

analyzed: bojjhaṅgānaṃ ekarasa ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: Development in the sense of singleness of goal of the enlightenment factors.

original: Paggahaṭṭhena vīriyasambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāvayato vīriyasambojjhaṅgassa vasena cha bojjhaṅgā ekarasā hontīti—
analyzed: paggaha ṭṭhena vīriya sambojjhaṅgam bhāvayato vīriya sambojjhaṅgassa vasena cha bojjhaṅgāḥ ekarasāḥ honti iti
translated: When he develops the enlightenment factor of energy by instigation he develops the seven enlightenment factors in such a way that they converge in the enlightenment factor of energy.

analyzed: bojjhaṅgānaṃ ekarasa ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: Development in the sense of singleness of goal of the enlightenment factors.

original: Pharaṇaṭṭhena pītisambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāvayato pītisambojjhaṅgassa vasena cha bojjhaṅgā ekarasā hontīti—
analyzed: pharaṇa ṭṭhena pīti sambojjhaṅgam bhāvayato pīti sambojjhaṅgassa vasena cha bojjhaṅgāḥ ekarasāḥ honti iti
translated: When he develops the enlightenment factor of rapture by surmounting he develops the seven enlightenment factors in such a way that they converge in the enlightenment factor of rapture.

analyzed: bojjhaṅgānaṃ ekarasa ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: Development in the sense of singleness of goal of the enlightenment factors.

original: Upasamaṭṭhena passaddhisambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāvayato passaddhisambojjhaṅgassa vasena cha bojjhaṅgā ekarasā hontīti—
analyzed: upasama ṭṭhena passaddhi sambojjhaṅgam bhāvayato passaddhi sambojjhaṅgassa vasena cha bojjhaṅgāḥ ekarasāḥ honti iti
translated: When he develops the enlightenment factor of tranquillity by tranquillization he develops the seven enlightenment factors in such a way that they converge in the enlightenment factor of tranquillity.

analyzed: bojjhaṅgānaṃ ekarasa ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: Development in the sense of singleness of goal of the enlightenment factors.

original: Avikkhepaṭṭhena samādhisambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāvayato samādhisambojjhaṅgassa vasena cha bojjhaṅgā ekarasā hontīti—
analyzed: avikkhepa ṭṭhena samādhi sambojjhaṅgam bhāvayato samādhi sambojjhaṅgassa vasena cha bojjhaṅgāḥ ekarasāḥ honti iti
translated: When he develops the enlightenment factor of concentration by non-distraction he develops the seven enlightenment factors in such a way that they converge in the enlightenment factor of concentration.🔽Development in the sense of singleness of goal of the enlightenment factors.

analyzed: bojjhaṅgānaṃ ekarasa ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: it is development in the sense of the single taste of the factors of enlightenment.

original: Paṭisaṅkhānaṭṭhena upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāvayato upekkhāsambojjhaṅgassa vasena cha bojjhaṅgā ekarasā hontīti—
analyzed: paṭisaṅkhāna ṭṭhena upekkhā sambojjhaṅgam bhāvayato upekkhā sambojjhaṅgassa vasena cha bojjhaṅgāḥ ekarasāḥ honti iti
translated: When he develops the equanimity factor of complete awakening by way of investigation, the seven factors of complete awakening come to have a single taste through the equanimity factor of complete awakening:

analyzed: bojjhaṅgānaṃ ekarasa ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: it is development in the sense of the single taste of the factors of complete awakening.

original: Dassanaṭṭhena sammādiṭṭhiṁ bhāvayato sammādiṭṭhiyā vasena satta maggaṅgā ekarasā hontīti—
analyzed: dassana ṭṭhena sammādiṭṭhim bhāvayato sammādiṭṭhiyāḥ vasena satta maggaṅgāḥ ekarasāḥ honti iti
translated: When he develops right view by way of seeing, the seven path factors come to have a single taste through right view:

analyzed: maggaṅgānaṃ ekarasa ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: it is development in the sense of the single taste of the path factors.

original: Abhiniropanaṭṭhena sammāsaṅkappaṁ bhāvayato sammāsaṅkappassa vasena satta maggaṅgā ekarasā hontīti—
analyzed: abhiniropana ṭṭhena sammāsaṅkappam bhāvayato sammāsaṅkappassa vasena satta maggaṅgāḥ ekarasāḥ honti iti
translated: When he develops right thought by way of directing, the seven path factors come to have a single taste through right thought:

analyzed: maggaṅgānaṃ ekarasa ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: it is development in the sense of the single taste of the path factors.

original: Pariggahaṭṭhena sammāvācaṁ bhāvayato sammāvācāya vasena satta maggaṅgā ekarasā hontīti—
analyzed: pariggaha ṭṭhena sammāvācam bhāvayato sammāvācāya vasena satta maggaṅgāḥ ekarasāḥ honti iti
translated: When he develops right speech by way of embracing, the seven path factors come to have a single taste through right speech:

analyzed: maggaṅgānaṃ ekarasa ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: it is development in the sense of the single taste of the path factors.

original: Samuṭṭhānaṭṭhena sammākammantaṁ bhāvayato sammākammantassa vasena satta maggaṅgā ekarasā hontīti—
analyzed: samuṭṭhāna ṭṭhena sammākammantam bhāvayato sammākammantassa vasena satta maggaṅgāḥ ekarasāḥ honti iti
translated: When he develops right action by way of origination, the seven path factors come to have a single taste through right action:

analyzed: maggaṅgānaṃ ekarasa ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: it is development in the sense of the single taste of the path factors.

original: Vodānaṭṭhena sammāājīvaṁ bhāvayato sammāājīvassa vasena satta maggaṅgā ekarasā hontīti—
analyzed: vodāna aṭṭhena sammāājīvam bhāvayato sammāājīvassa vasena satta maggaṅgāḥ ekarasāḥ honti iti
translated: When he develops right livelihood by means of the purification of livelihood, the seven path factors have a single function in him in the sense of right livelihood.

analyzed: maggaṅgānaṃ ekarasa ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: So it is the singleness consisting in the unification of the path factors that is meant by “development.”

original: Paggahaṭṭhena sammāvāyāmaṁ bhāvayato sammāvāyāmassa vasena satta maggaṅgā ekarasā hontīti—
analyzed: paggaha ṭṭhena sammāvāyāmam bhāvayato sammāvāyāmassa vasena satta maggaṅgāḥ ekarasāḥ honti iti
translated: When he develops right effort by means of the purification of effort, the seven path factors have a single function in him in the sense of right effort.

analyzed: maggaṅgānaṃ ekarasa ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: So it is the singleness consisting in the unification of the path factors that is meant by “development.”

original: Upaṭṭhānaṭṭhena sammāsatiṁ bhāvayato sammāsatiyā vasena satta maggaṅgā ekarasā hontīti—
analyzed: upaṭṭhāna ṭṭhena sammāsatim bhāvayato sammāsatiyāḥ vasena satta maggaṅgāḥ ekarasāḥ honti iti
translated: When he develops right mindfulness by means of the purification of mindfulness, the seven path factors have a single function in him in the sense of right mindfulness.

analyzed: maggaṅgānaṃ ekarasa ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: So it is the singleness consisting in the unification of the path factors that is meant by “development.”

original: Avikkhepaṭṭhena sammāsamādhiṁ bhāvayato sammāsamādhissa vasena satta maggaṅgā ekarasā hontīti—🔽maggaṅgānaṁ ekarasaṭṭhena bhāvanā.
analyzed: avikkhepa ṭṭhena sammāsamādhim bhāvayato sammāsamādhissa vasena satta maggaṅgāḥ ekarasāḥ honti iti  maggaṅgānaṃ ekarasa ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: When he develops right concentration by means of the purification of concentration, the seven path factors have a single function in him in the sense of right concentration.🔽So it is the singleness consisting in the unification of the path factors that is meant by “development.”

analyzed: ayam eka rasa bhāvanā
translated: This is the development of the path factors as single in function.

analyzed: katamā āsevanā bhāvanā
translated: What is development as repetition?

original: Idha bhikkhu pubbaṇhasamayaṁ āsevati, majjhanhikasamayampi āsevati, sāyanhasamayampi
analyzed: idha bhikkhu pubbaṇha samayam āsevati majjhanhika samayam pi āsevati sāyanha samayam pi
translated: Here a bhikkhu repeats the path in the morning, repeats it in the middle of the day, and repeats it in the evening,

original: āsevati, purebhattampi āsevati, pacchābhattampi āsevati, purimepi yāme āsevati, majjhimepi🔽yāme āsevati, pacchimepi yāme āsevati, rattimpi āsevati, divāpi āsevati, rattindivāpi🔽āsevati, kāḷepi āsevati, juṇhepi āsevati, vassepi āsevati, hemantepi āsevati, gimhepi🔽āsevati, purimepi vayokhandhe āsevati, majjhimepi vayokhandhe āsevati, pacchimepi
analyzed: āsevati purebhattam pi āsevati pacchābhattam pi āsevati purime pi yāme āsevati majjhime pi  yāme āsevati pacchime pi yāme āsevati rattim pi āsevati divā api āsevati rattin divā api  āsevati kāḷe api āsevati juṇhe pi āsevati vasse api āsevati hemante api āsevati gimhe pi  āsevati purime api vayaḥ khandhe āsevati majjhime api vayaḥ khandhe āsevati pacchime pi
translated: he associates with them in the morning, he associates with them in the evening,🔽he associates with them in the first watch of the night, he associates with them in the middle watch of the night,🔽he associates with them in the last watch of the night, he associates with them by night, he associates with them by day,🔽he associates with them both by night and by day, he associates with them in the dark, he associates with them in the bright,🔽he associates with them in the rainy season, he associates with them in the winter, he associates with them in the summer,🔽he associates with them in the first part of life, he associates with them in the middle part of life, he associates with them in the latter part of life,

analyzed: vayaḥ khandhe āsevati
translated: he associates with them in the morning, he associates with them in the evening, he associates with them in the first watch of the night, he associates with them in the middle watch of the night, he associates with them in the last watch of the night, he associates with them by night, he associates with them by day, he associates with them both by night and by day, he associates with them in the dark half of the month, he associates with them in the bright half of the month, he associates with them in winter, he associates with them in the cool season, he associates with them in the hot season, he associates with them in the first phase of life, he associates with them in the middle phase of life, he associates with them in the last phase of life—

analyzed: ayam āsevanā bhāvanā
translated: this is development through association.

analyzed: imāḥ catassaḥ bhāvanāḥ
translated: These are the four developments.

analyzed: aparā api bhāvanā
translated: There are four more developments:

original: tattha jātānaṁ dhammānaṁ anativattanaṭṭhena bhāvanā, indriyānaṁ ekarasaṭṭhena bhāvanā, tadupagavīriyavāhanaṭṭhena bhāvanā, āsevanaṭṭhena bhāvanā.
analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam anativattana ṭhena bhāvanā indriyānaṃ ekarasa ṭṭhena bhāvanā tad upaga vīriya vāhana ṭṭhena bhāvanā āsevana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: Development in the sense of not overstepping what has been entered upon, development in the sense of the single function of the faculties, development in the sense of the conveyance of the appropriate energy, development in the sense of repetition.

original: Kathaṁ tattha jātānaṁ dhammānaṁ anativattanaṭṭhena bhāvanā?
analyzed: katham tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: How is development in the sense of not overstepping what has been entered upon?

original: Kāmacchandaṁ pajahato nekkhammavasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: kāmacchandam pajahataḥ nekkhamma vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons zeal for sensual desires, the ideas produced by means of renunciation do not overstep each other,

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: and that is why there is development in the sense of non-over tstepping of the ideas produced there.

original: Byāpādaṁ pajahato abyāpādavasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: byāpādam pajahataḥ a byāpāda vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons ill will, the ideas produced by means of non-ill will do not overstep each other,

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: and that is why there is development in the sense of non-over tstepping of the ideas produced there.

original: Thinamiddhaṁ pajahato ālokasaññāvasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: thinam iddham pajahato āloka saññā vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons stiffness and torpor, the ideas produced by means of perception of light do not overstep each other,

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: and that is why there is development in the sense of non-over tstepping of the ideas produced there.

original: Uddhaccaṁ pajahato avikkhepavasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: uddhaccam pajahataḥ avikkhepa vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons agitation and worry, the ideas produced by means of non-distraction do not overstep each other,

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: and that is why there is development in the sense of non-over tstepping of the ideas produced there.

original: Vicikicchaṁ pajahato dhammavavatthānavasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: vicikiccham pajahataḥ dhamma vavatthāna vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons uncertainty, the ideas produced by means of definition of ideas do not overstep each other,

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: and that is why there is development in the sense of non-over tstepping of the ideas produced there.

original: Avijjaṁ pajahato ñāṇavasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: avijjam pajahataḥ ñāṇa vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons ignorance, the ideas produced by the means of knowledge do not overshoot one another.

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: Herein, development is in the sense of non-overshooting of ideas produced.

original: Aratiṁ pajahato pāmojjavasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: aratim pajahataḥ pāmojja vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons disquiet, the ideas produced by means of gladness do not overshoot one another.

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: Herein, development is in the sense of non-overshooting of ideas produced.

original: Nīvaraṇe pajahato paṭhamajjhānavasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: nīvaraṇe pajahato paṭhamajjhāna vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons the hindrances, the ideas produced by the first jhana do not overshoot one another.

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: Herein, development is in the sense of non-overshooting of ideas produced.

original: Vitakkavicāre pajahato dutiyajjhānavasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: vitakka vicāre pajahataḥ dutiya jhāna vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons applied and sustained thought, the ideas produced by the second jhana do not overshoot one another.

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: Herein, development is in the sense of non-overshooting of ideas produced.

original: Pītiṁ pajahato tatiyajjhānavasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: pītim pajahataḥ tatiya jhāna vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons happiness, the ideas produced by the third jhana do not overshoot one another.

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: Herein, development is in the sense of non-overshooting of ideas produced.

original: Sukhadukkhe pajahato catutthajjhānavasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: sukha dukkhe pajahato catuttha jhāna vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons pleasure and pain, the ideas arisen in him through the fourth jhāna do not overshoot each other.

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: So in this way development is in the sense of non-overshooting of ideas arisen there.

original: Rūpasaññaṁ paṭighasaññaṁ nānattasaññaṁ pajahato ākāsānañcāyatanasamāpattivasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: rūpa saññam paṭigha saññam nānatta saññam pajahataḥ ākāsa anañca āyatana samāpatti vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons perceptions of matter, perceptions of resistance, and perceptions of variety, the ideas arisen in him through the attainment of the base consisting of boundless space do not overshoot each other.

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: So in this way development is in the sense of non-overshooting of ideas arisen there.

original: Ākāsānañcāyatanasaññaṁ pajahato viññāṇañcāyatanasamāpattivasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: ākāsa anañcāyatana saññam pajahataḥ viññāṇañcāyatana samāpatti vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons perception of the base consisting of boundless space, the ideas arisen in him through the attainment of the base consisting of boundless consciousness do not overshoot each other.

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: So in this way development is in the sense of non-overshooting of ideas arisen there.

original: Viññāṇañcāyatanasaññaṁ pajahato ākiñcaññāyatanasamāpattivasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: viññāṇañcāyatana saññam pajahato ākiñcaññāyatana samāpatti vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons perception of the base consisting of boundless consciousness, the ideas arisen in him through the attainment of the base consisting of nothingness do not overshoot each other.

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: So in this way development is in the sense of non-overshooting of ideas arisen there.

original: Ākiñcaññāyatanasaññaṁ pajahato nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasamāpattivasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: ākiñcaññāyatana saññam pajahataḥ nevasaññānāsaññāyatana samāpatti vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons perception of the base of nothingness, the ideas produced in the form of the attainment of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception do not overshoot each other:

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: so there is development in the sense of non-overshooting of ideas produced there.

original: Niccasaññaṁ pajahato aniccānupassanāvasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: nicca saññam pajahataḥ anicca anupassanā vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons perception of permanence, the ideas produced in the form of contemplation of impermanence do not overshoot each other:

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: so there is development in the sense of non-overshooting of ideas produced there.

original: Sukhasaññaṁ pajahato dukkhānupassanāvasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: sukha saññam pajahataḥ dukkha anupassanā vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons perception of pleasure, the ideas produced in the form of contemplation of pain do not overshoot each other:

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: so there is development in the sense of non-overshooting of ideas produced there.

original: Attasaññaṁ pajahato anattānupassanāvasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: atta saññam pajahataḥ anatta anupassanā vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons perception of self, the ideas produced in the form of contemplation of not self do not overshoot each other:

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: so there is development in the sense of non-overshooting of ideas produced there.

original: Nandiṁ pajahato nibbidānupassanāvasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: nandim pajahataḥ nibbidā anupassanā vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons delight, the ideas produced in the form of contemplation of dispassion do not overshoot each other:

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: so there is development in the sense of non-overshooting of ideas produced there.

original: Rāgaṁ pajahato virāgānupassanāvasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: rāgam pajahataḥ virāga anupassanā vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons greed, the ideas produced by the contemplation of fading away do not overshoot one another,

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: so there is development in the sense of non-overshooting of the ideas produced.

original: Samudayaṁ pajahato nirodhānupassanāvasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: samudayam pajahataḥ nirodha anupassanā vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons origination, the ideas produced by the contemplation of cessation do not overshoot one another,

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: so there is development in the sense of non-overshooting of the ideas produced.

original: Ādānaṁ pajahato paṭinissaggānupassanāvasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: ādānam pajahato paṭinissagga anupassanā vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons grasping, the ideas produced by the contemplation of relinquishment do not overshoot one another,

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: so there is development in the sense of non-overshooting of the ideas produced.

original: Ghanasaññaṁ pajahato khayānupassanāvasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: ghana saññam pajahato khaya anupassanā vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons the perception of compactness, the ideas produced by the contemplation of destruction do not overshoot one another,

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: so there is development in the sense of non-overshooting of the ideas produced.

original: Āyūhanaṁ pajahato vayānupassanāvasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: āyūhanam pajahataḥ vayā anupassanā vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons accumulation, the ideas produced by the contemplation of fall do not overshoot one another,

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: so there is development in the sense of non-overshooting of the ideas produced.

original: Dhuvasaññaṁ pajahato vipariṇāmānupassanāvasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: dhuva saññam pajahataḥ vipariṇāma anupassanā vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons the perception of permanence, the ideas produced do not overstep each other in the contemplation of fall.

original: tattha jātānaṁ dhammānaṁ anativattanaṭṭhena bhāvanā.🔽Nimittaṁ pajahato animittānupassanāvasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā  nimittam pajahataḥ animitta anupassanā vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: Herein, development is in the sense of non-over tstepping of the ideas produced.🔽When he abandons the sign, the ideas produced do not overstep each other in the contemplation of signlessness.🔽Herein, development is in the sense of non-over tstepping of the ideas produced.

original: tattha jātānaṁ dhammānaṁ anativattanaṭṭhena bhāvanā. paṇidhiṁ pajahato appaṇihitānupassanāvasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā paṇidhim pajahataḥ appaṇihita anupassanā vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons wish, the ideas produced do not overstep each other in the contemplation of wishlessness.

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: Herein, development is in the sense of non-over tstepping of the ideas produced.

original: Abhinivesaṁ pajahato suññatānupassanāvasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: abhinivesam pajahato suñña tā anupassanā vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons misinterpreting, the ideas produced do not overstep each other in the contemplation of voidness.

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: Herein, development is in the sense of non-over tstepping of the ideas produced.

original: Sārādānābhinivesaṁ pajahato adhipaññā dhammavipassanāvasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: sāra ādāna abhinivesam pajahataḥ adhipaññāḥ dhamma vipassanā vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons misinterpreting as self, the ideas produced do not overstep each other in the higher understanding of insight into ideas.

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: Herein, development is in the sense of non-over tstepping of the ideas produced.

original: Sammohābhinivesaṁ pajahato yathābhūtañāṇadassanavasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: sammoha abhinivesam pajahataḥ yathā bhūta ñāṇa dassana vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons cleaving to false view, the ideas produced by him do not overstep each other in the sense of non-over treading of what is produced,1 in virtue of the knowledge and vision of things as they are.

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: Herein, in the sense of non-over treading of what is produced, there is development.

original: Ālayābhinivesaṁ pajahato ādīnavānupassanāvasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: ālaya abhinivesam pajahataḥ ādīnava anupassanā vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons cleaving to rituals and observances, the ideas produced by him do not overstep each other in the sense of non-over treading of what is produced, in virtue of contemplation of disappointment.

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: Herein, in the sense of non-over treading of what is produced, there is development.

original: Appaṭisaṅkhaṁ pajahato paṭisaṅkhānupassanāvasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: appaṭisaṅkham pajahato paṭisaṅkhā anupassanā vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons non-reflection, the ideas produced by him do not overstep each other in the sense of non-over treading of what is produced, in virtue of contemplation of reflection.

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: Herein, in the sense of non-over treading of what is produced, there is development.

original: Saññogābhinivesaṁ pajahato vivaṭṭanānupassanāvasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: saññoga abhinivesam pajahataḥ vivaṭṭana anupassanā vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons cleaving to a doctrine of self, the ideas produced by him do not overstep each other in the sense of non-over treading of what is produced, in virtue of contemplation of relinking.

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: Herein, in the sense of non-over treading of what is produced, there is development.

original: Diṭṭhekaṭṭhe kilese pajahato sotāpattimaggavasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: diṭṭhekaṭṭhe kilese pajahato sotāpatti magga vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons defilements in a single-group and double-group 1 basis, the ideas produced by him do not overstep each other in the sense of non-over treading of what is produced, in virtue of the Stream-Entry Path.

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: Herein, development in the sense of non-excess of ideas produced is this.

original: Oḷārike kilese pajahato sakadāgāmimaggavasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: oḷārike kilese pajahato sakadāgāmi magga vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons gross defilements, the ideas produced in him by means of the path of once-returner do not exceed each other.

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: Herein, development in the sense of non-excess of ideas produced is this.

original: Anusahagate kilese pajahato anāgāmimaggavasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—
analyzed: anu sahagate kilese pajahataḥ anāgāmi magga vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti
translated: When he abandons residual defilements, the ideas produced in him by means of the path of non-returner do not exceed each other.

analyzed: tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: Herein, development in the sense of non-excess of ideas produced is this.

original: Sabbakilese pajahato arahattamaggavasena jātā dhammā aññamaññaṁ nātivattantīti—🔽tattha jātānaṁ dhammānaṁ anativattanaṭṭhena bhāvanā.
analyzed: sabba kilese pajahataḥ arahatta magga vasena jātāḥ dhammāḥ aññam aññam na ativattanti iti  tattha jātānam dhammānam an ativattana ṭṭhena bhāvanā
translated: When he abandons all defilements, the ideas produced in him by means of the path of Arahantship do not exceed each other.🔽Herein, development in the sense of non-excess of ideas produced is this.

original: Evaṁ tattha jātānaṁ dhammānaṁ anativattanaṭṭhena bhāvanā.

translated: This is how there is development in the sense of non-excess of ideas produced.

analyzed: katham bhāvanā

original: Kāmacchandaṁ pajahato nekkhammavasena pañcindriyāni ekarasā hontīti—

translated: Herein, development in the sense of the faculties’ single function is this.

original: Byāpādaṁ pajahato abyāpādavasena pañcindriyāni ekarasā hontīti—
