analyzed: citta samādhi pe
translated: concentration due to mind …

original: vīmaṁsāsamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṁ iddhipādaṁ bhāveti.🔽So imesu catūsu iddhipādesu cittaṁ paribhāveti paridameti, muduṁ karoti kammaniyaṁ.
analyzed: iddhipādam bhāva iti  saḥ imesu catūsu iddhipādesu cittam paribhāveti paridameti mudum karoti
translated: He develops the road to power that is concentration of energy…🔽He develops the road to power that is concentration of mind…🔽He develops the road to power that is concentration of investigation…🔽He trains like this: ‘I will breathe in experiencing rapture’; he trains like this: ‘I will breathe out experiencing rapture.’

original: So imesu catūsu iddhipādesu cittaṁ paribhāvetvā paridametvā, muduṁ karitvā kammaniyaṁ evaṁ pajānāti—🔽“idaṁ rūpaṁ somanassindriyasamuṭṭhitaṁ, idaṁ rūpaṁ domanassindriyasamuṭṭhitaṁ, idaṁ rūpaṁ upekkhindriyasamuṭṭhitan”ti.🔽So tathābhāvitena cittena parisuddhena pariyodātena cetopariyañāṇāya cittaṁ abhinīharati abhininnāmeti.
analyzed: saḥ imesu catūsu iddhipādesu cittam paribhāvetvā paridametvā mudum karitvā kammaniyam evam pajānāti  idam rūpam somanassa indriya samuṭṭhite idam rūpam domanassa indriya samuṭṭhite idam rūpam upekkhindriya samuṭṭhitanti  saḥ tathā bhāvitena cittena parisuddhena pariyodātena cetaḥ pariya ñāṇāya cittam abhinīharati abhininnāma iti
translated: He trains like this: ‘I will breathe in experiencing pleasure’; he trains like this: ‘I will breathe out experiencing pleasure.’🔽He trains like this: ‘I will breathe in experiencing the mental processes’; he trains like this: ‘I will breathe out experiencing the mental processes.’🔽He trains like this: ‘I will breathe in experiencing the mind’; he trains like this: ‘I will breathe out experiencing the mind.’🔽He trains like this: ‘I will breathe in satisfying the mind’; he trains like this: ‘I will breathe out satisfying the mind.’🔽He trains like this: ‘I will breathe in steadying the mind’; he trains like this: ‘I will breathe out steadying the mind.’

original: So parasattānaṁ parapuggalānaṁ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāti—🔽sarāgaṁ vā cittaṁ “sarāgaṁ cittan”ti pajānāti,🔽vītarāgaṁ vā cittaṁ “vītarāgaṁ cittan”ti pajānāti,
analyzed: so para sattānam para puggalānam cetasā cetaḥ paricca pajānāti  sa rāgam vā cittam sa rāgam cittam iti pajānāti  vīta rāgam vā cittam vīta rāgam cittam iti pajānāti
translated: He trains like this: ‘I will breathe in releasing the mind’; he trains like this: ‘I will breathe out releasing the mind.’🔽He trains like this: ‘I will breathe in experiencing the mind as the mind’; he trains like this: ‘I will breathe out experiencing the mind as the mind.’🔽He trains like this: ‘I will breathe in gladdening the mind’; he trains like this: ‘I will breathe out gladdening the mind.’

analyzed: sa dosam vā cittam pe  vīta dosam vā cittam
translated: He trains like this: ‘I will breathe in concentrating the mind’; he trains like this: ‘I will breathe out concentrating the mind.’🔽He trains like this: ‘I will breathe in freeing the mind’; he trains like this: ‘I will breathe out freeing the mind.’🔽He trains like this: ‘I will breathe in experiencing the mind as the mind’; he trains like this: ‘I will breathe out experiencing the mind as the mind.’🔽He trains like this: ‘I will breathe in satisfying the mind’; he trains like this: ‘I will breathe out satisfying the mind.’

analyzed: sa moham vā cittam
translated: He trains like this: ‘I will breathe in steadying the mind’; he trains like this: ‘I will breathe out steadying the mind.’🔽He trains like this: ‘I will breathe in releasing the mind’; he trains like this: ‘I will breathe out releasing the mind.’

analyzed: vīta moham vā cittam
translated: or a mind free from delusion as free from delusion.

original: saṅkhittaṁ vā cittaṁ …🔽vikkhittaṁ vā cittaṁ …🔽mahaggataṁ vā cittaṁ …
analyzed: saṅkhittam vā cittam  vikkhittam vā cittam  mahaggatam vā cittam
translated: or a contracted mind as contracted,🔽or a distracted mind as distracted,🔽or a developed mind as developed,

analyzed: a mahaggatam vā cittam  sauttaram vā cittam
translated: or an undeveloped mind as undeveloped,🔽or a surpassed mind as surpassed,

original: anuttaraṁ vā cittaṁ …🔽samāhitaṁ vā cittaṁ …🔽asamāhitaṁ vā cittaṁ …
analyzed: anuttaram vā cittam  samāhitam vā cittam  asamāhitam vā cittam
translated: or an unsurpassed mind as unsurpassed,🔽or a concentrated mind as concentrated,🔽or an unconcentrated mind as unconcentrated,

analyzed: vimuttam vā cittam
translated: or a liberated mind as liberated,

analyzed: a vimuttam vā cittam a vimuttam cittam iti pajānāti
translated: or an unliberated mind as unliberated.🔽That is knowledge,

original: Taṁ ñātaṭṭhena ñāṇaṁ, pajānanaṭṭhena paññā.🔽Tena vuccati—🔽“tiṇṇaṁ cittānaṁ vipphārattā indriyānaṁ pasādavasena nānattekattaviññāṇacariyāpariyogāhaṇe paññā cetopariyañāṇaṁ”.
analyzed: tam ñāta ṭṭhena pajānana ṭṭhena paññā  tena vuccati  tiṇṇam cittānam vipphāra ttā indriyānam pasāda vasena nānatta ekatta viññāṇa cariyā pariyogāhaṇe paññā cetas pariya ñāṇa
translated: and vision, and wisdom, and insight, and light.

analyzed: cetas upariya ñāṇa niddesaḥ dvepaññāsamo
translated: This is called knowledge of encompassing the minds of others.🔽The fiftieth chapter.
The knowledge of recollecting past lives

original: Kathaṁ paccayapavattānaṁ dhammānaṁ nānattekattakammavipphāravasena pariyogāhaṇe paññā pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇaṁ?
analyzed: katham paccaya pavattānam dhammānam nānatta ekatta kamma vipphāra vasena pariyogāhaṇe paññā pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇa
translated: How is it that knowledge of recollecting past lives is the act of establishing in one’s own mind the various kinds of past action that have resulted in the occurrence of these conditions?

analyzed: idha bhikkhu chanda samādhi pe
translated: Here a monk recollects his manifold past lives, that is, one birth, two five, ten fifty, a hundred, a thousand, a hundred thousand, many eons of cosmic contraction, many eons of cosmic expansion, many eons of cosmic contraction and expansion:

analyzed: mudum karitvā kammaniyam evam pajānāti
translated: He makes the mind malleable, wieldy, and bright.

original: “imasmiṁ sati idaṁ hoti, imassuppādā idaṁ uppajjati, yadidaṁ—
analyzed: imasmin sati idam hoti imassa uppādāḥ idam uppajjati
translated: When this exists, that comes to be; with the arising of this, that arises. That is:

original: avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārā, saṅkhārapaccayā viññāṇaṁ, viññāṇapaccayā nāmarūpaṁ, nāmarūpapaccayā
analyzed: avijjā paccayā saṅkhārā saṅkhāra paccayā viññāṇa viññāṇa paccayā nāma rūpa nāma rūpa paccayā
translated: With ignorance as condition, volitional formations [come to be]; with volitional formations as condition, consciousness; with consciousness as condition, name-and-form;

original: saḷāyatanaṁ, saḷāyatanapaccayā phasso, phassapaccayā vedanā, vedanāpaccayā taṇhā,🔽taṇhāpaccayā upādānaṁ, upādānapaccayā bhavo, bhavapaccayā jāti, jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇaṁ
analyzed: saḷāyatana saḷāyatana paccayā phassaḥ phassa paccayā vedanā vedanā paccayā taṇhā  taṇhā paccayā upādāna upādāna paccayā bhavaḥ bhava paccayā jāti jāti paccayā jarā maraṇa
translated: with name-and-form as condition, the six sense spheres; with the six sense spheres as condition, contact; with contact as condition, feeling; with feeling as condition, craving;

analyzed: soka parideva dukkha domanassa upāyāsā sambhavanti
translated: with craving as condition, clinging; with clinging as condition, existence; with existence as condition, birth; with birth as condition, aging, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, displeasure, and despair come to be.

analyzed: evam etassa kevalassa dukkha kkhandhassa samudayaḥ hoti
translated: Such is the origin of this whole mass of suffering.

original: So tathābhāvitena cittena parisuddhena pariyodātena pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇāya cittaṁ abhinīharati abhininnāmeti.
analyzed: saḥ tathā bhāvitena cittena parisuddhena pariyodātena pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇāya cittam abhinīharati abhininnāmeti
translated: With his mind thus concentrated, purified, and bright, unblemished, free from defects, pliant, malleable, steady, and attained to imperturbability, he directs and inclines it to the knowledge of the recollection of past lives.

analyzed: so aneka vihitam pubbenivāsam anussarati
translated: He recollects his manifold past lives, i.e., one birth, two five, ten fifty, a hundred, a thousand, a hundred thousand, many eons of cosmic contraction, many eons of cosmic expansion, many eons of cosmic contraction and expansion:

original: ekampi jātiṁ dvepi jātiyo tissopi jātiyo catassopi jātiyo pañcapi jātiyo dasapi jātiyo🔽vīsampi jātiyo tiṁsampi jātiyo cattālīsampi jātiyo paññāsampi jātiyo, jātisatampi
analyzed: ekam pi jātim dve pi jātiyaḥ tisso api jātiyaḥ catasso pi jātiyaḥ pañca api jātiyaḥ dasa api jātiyaḥ  vīsampi jātiyo tisampi jātiyo cattālīsampi jātiyo paññāsampi jātiyaḥ jāti satampi
translated: ten births, twenty births, thirty births, forty births, fifty births,🔽a hundred births, a thousand births, a hundred thousand births,

original: jātisahassampi jātisatasahassampi, anekepi saṁvaṭṭakappe anekepi vivaṭṭakappe anekepi
analyzed: jāti sahassam pi jāti sata sahassam pi aneke pi savaṭṭa kappe aneke pi vivaṭṭa kappe aneke pi
translated: many aeons of world-contraction, many aeons of world-expansion, many aeons of world-contraction and expansion.🔽He recollects his manifold past lives, i.e. with features and details.🔽This is knowledge of recollection of past lives.

analyzed: sa vaṭṭa vivaṭṭa kappe
translated: This is the third knowledge.🔽He sees beings passing away and being reborn—inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, in a good place or a bad place—according as kamma has made them.🔽He understands how beings pass on according to their kamma.

original: “amutrāsiṁ evaṁnāmo evaṅgotto evaṁvaṇṇo evamāhāro evaṁsukhadukkhappaṭisaṁvedī evamāyupariyanto, so tato cuto amutra udapādiṁ;
analyzed: amutra asim eva nāmaḥ evaṃgotto eva vaṇṇo evam āhāro eva sukha dukkha paṭisavedī evam āyu pariyanto saḥ tatas cutaḥ amutra udapādi
translated: This is knowledge of the passing away and rebirth of beings.🔽This is the fourth knowledge.

original: tatrāpāsiṁ evaṁnāmo evaṅgotto evaṁvaṇṇo evamāhāro evaṁsukhadukkhappaṭisaṁvedī evamāyupariyanto, so tato cuto idhūpapanno”ti.
analyzed: tatra apāsim eva nāmaḥ evaṃgotto eva vaṇṇo evam āhāro eva sukha dukkha paṭisavedī evam āyu pariyanto saḥ tatas cutaḥ idhu upapanno ti
translated: With his purified and heightened clairvoyance, he sees beings passing away and being reborn—inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, in a good place or a bad place—according as kamma has made them.

original: Iti sākāraṁ sauddesaṁ anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarati.
analyzed: iti sa ākāram sa uddesam aneka vihitam pubbenivāsam anussarati
translated: He understands how beings pass on according to their kamma.🔽This is knowledge of the passing away and rebirth of beings.

original: Taṁ ñātaṭṭhena ñāṇaṁ, pajānanaṭṭhena paññā.🔽Tena vuccati—
analyzed: tam ñāta ṭṭhena pajānana ṭṭhena paññā 🔽tena vuccati
translated: This is the fourth knowledge.

analyzed: paccaya pavattānam dhammānam nānatta ekatta kamma vipphāra vasena pariyogāhaṇe paññā pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇa  pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇa niddesaḥ tepaññāsamaḥ
translated: Understanding of the discernment of the various and multiple kinds of past activities and their results is knowledge of recollection of past lives.

analyzed: dibba cakkhu ñāṇa niddesa
translated: The fiftieth chapter in the detailed explanation of knowledge of recollection of past lives.🔽… Knowledge of the divine eye

original: Kathaṁ obhāsavasena nānattekattarūpanimittānaṁ dassanaṭṭhe paññā dibbacakkhuñāṇaṁ?
analyzed: katham obhāsa vasena nānatta ekatta rūpa nimittānam dassana aṭṭhe paññā dibba cakkhu ñāṇa
translated: How, in the sense of illuminating, is understanding of the seeing of the various and multiple signs of form knowledge of the divine eye?

original: Idha bhikkhu chandasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṁ iddhipādaṁ bhāveti, vīriyasamādhi …pe…
analyzed: idha bhikkhu chanda samādhi padhāna saṅkhāra samannāgatam iddhipādam bhāveti vīriya samādhi pe
translated: Here a bhikkhu develops the basis for spiritual power that possesses concentration due to desire and volitional formations of striving.🔽He develops the basis for spiritual power that possesses concentration due to energy…

original: cittasamādhi …pe…🔽vīmaṁsāsamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṁ iddhipādaṁ bhāveti.🔽So imesu catūsu iddhipādesu cittaṁ paribhāveti paridameti, muduṁ karoti kammaniyaṁ.
analyzed: citta samādhi pe  iddhipādam bhāva iti  saḥ imesu catūsu iddhipādesu cittam paribhāveti paridameti mudum karoti
translated: concentration due to mind…🔽concentration due to investigation and volitional formations of striving.🔽He wields bodily power and mental power in such a way that he directs his body by his mind and he directs his mind by his body.

original: So imesu catūsu iddhipādesu cittaṁ paribhāvetvā paridametvā, muduṁ karitvā kammaniyaṁ ālokasaññaṁ manasi karoti, divāsaññaṁ adhiṭṭhāti—
analyzed: saḥ imesu catūsu iddhipādesu cittam paribhāvetvā paridametvā mudum karitvā kammaniyam āloka saññam manasi karoti divāsaññam adhiṭṭhāti
translated: Having done so, he directs his mind to the perception of light, he focuses on it, determines on it, and resolves upon it.

original: “yathā divā tathā rattiṁ, yathā rattiṁ tathā divā”.
analyzed: yathā divā tathā ratti yathā rattim tathā divā
translated: ‘Just as during the day, so also during the night; just as during the night, so also during the day.’

original: Iti vivaṭena cetasā apariyonaddhena sappabhāsaṁ cittaṁ bhāveti.
analyzed: iti vivaṭena cetasā a pariyonaddhena sa pabhāsam cittam bhāveti
translated: In this way, with a mind that is open and unenveloped, he develops the mind imbued with luminosity.

original: So tathābhāvitena cittena parisuddhena pariyodātena sattānaṁ cutūpapātañāṇāya cittaṁ abhinīharati abhininnāmeti.
analyzed: saḥ tathā bhāvitena cittena parisuddhena pariyodātena sattānam cutūpapāta ñāṇāya cittam abhinīharati abhininnāma iti
translated: With a mind that is thus developed in this way, purified and bright, he directs it to the knowledge of the passing away and arising of beings.🔽With his divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, he sees beings passing away and arising: inferior and superior, fair and ugly, fortunate and unfortunate.

original: So dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena, satte passati cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate yathākammūpage satte pajānāti—🔽“ime vata bhonto sattā kāyaduccaritena samannāgatā, vacīduccaritena samannāgatā, manoduccaritena samannāgatā, ariyānaṁ upavādakā, micchādiṭṭhikā, micchādiṭṭhikammasamādānā;
analyzed: so dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkanta mānusakena satte passati cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate yathā kammūpage satte pajānāti  ime vata bhonto sattā kāya duccaritena samannāgatāḥ vacī duccaritena samannāgatāḥ manaḥ duccaritena samannāgatāḥ ariyānam upavādakāḥ micchādiṭṭhikāḥ micchādiṭṭhi kamma samādānāḥ
translated: He understands how beings pass on according to their actions (like this):

original: te kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapannā.
analyzed: te kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapannā
translated: ‘These worthy beings who are ill-conducted in body, speech, and mind, revilers of noble ones, wrong in their views, giving effect to wrong view, on the dissolution of the body, after death, have reappeared in a state of deprivation, in a bad destination, in perdition, even in hell.

original: Ime vā pana bhonto sattā kāyasucaritena samannāgatā, vacīsucaritena samannāgatā, manosucaritena samannāgatā ariyānaṁ anupavādakā, sammādiṭṭhikā sammādiṭṭhikammasamādānā;
analyzed: ime vā pana bhonto sattā kāya su caritena samannāgatāḥ vacī su caritena samannāgatāḥ manaḥ su caritena samannāgatāḥ ariyānam an upavādakā sammādiṭṭhikā sammādiṭṭhi kamma samādānā
translated: Or else, these beings who are endowed with bodily good conduct, verbal good conduct, and mental good conduct, who do not revile noble ones, who have right view and act accordingly,

original: te kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapannā”ti.
analyzed: te kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapannā ati
translated: after death, at the breaking-up of the body, are reborn in a good destination, in a heavenly world.’

original: Iti dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena satte passati cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe, sugate duggate yathākammūpage satte pajānāti.
analyzed: iti dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkanta mānusakena satte passati cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate yathā kammūpage satte pajānāti
translated: Thus with the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, he sees beings passing away and arising: base and noble, well favored and ill favored, to happy and unhappy destinations as kamma directs them.🔽This is knowledge as it really is of the seen, and so it is vision.

analyzed: tam ñāta ṭṭhena pajānana ṭṭhena paññā
translated: This is the meaning.

analyzed: tena vuccati
translated: It is said:

analyzed: obhāsa vasena nānatta ekatta rūpa nimittānam dassana aṭṭhe paññā dibba cakkhu ñāṇa  dibba cakkhu ñāṇa niddesaḥ catupaññāsamaḥ
translated: “Understanding of the seeing of the various and single signs of forms by means of illumination is knowledge of the divine eye.”🔽The fiftieth chapter.

analyzed: āsava kkhaya ñāṇa niddesa
translated: … Knowledge of the destruction of the taints

original: Kathaṁ catusaṭṭhiyā ākārehi tiṇṇannaṁ indriyānaṁ vasibhāvatā paññā āsavānaṁ khaye ñāṇaṁ?
analyzed: katham catusaṭṭhiyā ākārehi tiṇṇannam indriyānam vasibhāvatā paññā āsavānam khaye ñāṇa
translated: How is it that understanding of mastery of the three faculties in sixty-four aspects is knowledge of the destruction of the taints?

analyzed: katamesam tiṇṇannam
translated: Which three?

analyzed: an aññāta ññassa amīti indriyassa aññindriyassa aññātāvindriyassa
translated: The ‘I am making sense of what was not previously sensed’ faculty, the ‘I know’ faculty, and the ‘I have understood’ faculty.

original: Anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ kati ṭhānāni gacchati, aññindriyaṁ kati ṭhānāni gacchati, aññātāvindriyaṁ kati ṭhānāni gacchati?
analyzed: kati ṭhānāni gacchati aññindriyam kati ṭhānāni gacchati aññātāvindriyam kati ṭhānāni gacchati
translated: How many possibilities are there for the ‘I am making sense of what was not previously sensed’ faculty, the ‘I know’ faculty, and the ‘I have understood’ faculty?

analyzed: ekam ṭhānam gacchati
translated: There is one possibility for the ‘I am making sense of what was not previously sensed’ faculty:

analyzed: sa utāpatti magga
translated: the path of stream-entry.

analyzed: aññindriyam cha ṭhānāni gacchati
translated: There are six possibilities for the ‘I know’ faculty:

original: sotāpattiphalaṁ, sakadāgāmimaggaṁ, sakadāgāmiphalaṁ, anāgāmimaggaṁ, anāgāmiphalaṁ, arahattamaggaṁ.
analyzed: sotāpatti phala sakadāgāmi magga sakadāgāmi phala anāgāmi magga anāgāmi phala arahatta magga
translated: the fruit of stream-entry, the path of once-returning, the fruit of once-returning, the path of non-returning, the fruit of non-returning, and the path of perfection.

analyzed: aññātāvindriyam ekam ṭhānam gacchati
translated: There is one possibility for the ‘I have understood’ faculty:

analyzed: arahatta phala
translated: the fruit of perfection.

analyzed: sotāpatti magga kkhaṇe saddhindriyaṃ adhimokkha parivāra
translated: At the time of the path of stream-entry, the faith faculty of the ‘I am making sense of what was not previously sensed’ faculty is surrounded by resolution.

original: hoti, vīriyindriyaṁ paggahaparivāraṁ hoti, satindriyaṁ upaṭṭhānaparivāraṁ hoti, samādhindriyaṁ
analyzed: hoti vīriya indriyam paggaha parivāram hoti sati indriyam upaṭṭhāna parivāram hoti samādhi indriya
translated: The energy faculty is surrounded by exertion. The mindfulness faculty is surrounded by alertness. The concentration faculty is surrounded by stillness.

original: avikkhepaparivāraṁ hoti, paññindriyaṁ dassanaparivāraṁ hoti, manindriyaṁ vijānanaparivāraṁ
analyzed: avikkhepa parivāram hoti paññā indriyam dassana parivāram hoti manindriyam vijānana parivāra
translated: the mindfulness faculty has the surrounding of non-distraction, the concentration faculty has the surrounding of the right view, the understanding faculty has the surrounding of seeing, the mind faculty has the surrounding of discerning,

original: hoti, somanassindriyaṁ abhisandanaparivāraṁ hoti, jīvitindriyaṁ pavattasantatādhipateyyaparivāraṁ hoti.
analyzed: hoti somanassa indriyam abhisandana parivāram hoti jīvita indriyam pavatta santata ādhipateyya parivāram hoti
translated: the joy faculty has the surrounding of gladdening, the life faculty has the surrounding of the predominance of the continuity of the process.

original: Sotāpattimaggakkhaṇe jātā dhammā ṭhapetvā cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ sabbeva kusalā honti,
analyzed: sotāpatti magga kkhaṇe jātāḥ dhammāḥ ṭhapetvā citta samuṭṭhānam rūpam sabbe eva kusalāḥ honti
translated: At the moment of the path of stream-entry, the ideas that have arisen, except for the materiality originated by consciousness, are all profitable,

original: sabbeva anāsavā honti, sabbeva niyyānikā honti, sabbeva apacayagāmino honti, sabbeva
analyzed: sabbe iva anāsavāḥ honti sabbe iva niyyānikāḥ honti sabbe iva apacaya gāminaḥ honti sabbe iva
translated: all are without taints, all are emancipating, all lead to the abatement ,

analyzed: lokuttarāḥ honti sabbe iva nibbāna ārammaṇāḥ honti
translated: all are supramundane, all have nibbana as their object.

original: Sotāpattimaggakkhaṇe anaññātaññassāmītindriyassa imāni aṭṭhindriyāni sahajātaparivārā🔽honti, aññamaññaparivārā honti, nissayaparivārā honti, sampayuttaparivārā honti,
analyzed: sotāpatti magga kkhaṇe imāni aṭṭhindriyāni sahajāta parivārā  honti aññamañña parivārāḥ honti nissaya parivārāḥ honti sampayutta parivārāḥ honti
translated: At the moment of the path of stream-entry, these eight faculties are the in-group of the faculty of final knowledge of the unknown,🔽they are the mutual-in-group, the support-in-group, the associated-in-group,

original: sahagatā honti, sahajātā honti, saṁsaṭṭhā honti, sampayuttā honti.
analyzed: sahagatāḥ honti sahajātāḥ honti sa saṭṭhāḥ honti sampayuttāḥ honti
translated: they are conjoined, they are conascent, they are coincident, they are conjoined and conascent, they are conjoined and coincident, they are conascent and coincident, they are conjoined, conascent, and coincident.

original: Teva tassa ākārā ceva honti parivārā ca.
analyzed: teva tassa ākārā ca iva honti parivārā ca
translated: They are its modes and its in-group.

original: Sotāpattiphalakkhaṇe aññindriyassa saddhindriyaṁ adhimokkhaparivāraṁ hoti, vīriyindriyaṁ🔽paggahaparivāraṁ hoti, satindriyaṁ upaṭṭhānaparivāraṁ hoti, samādhindriyaṁ avikkhepaparivāraṁ
analyzed: sotāpatti phala kkhaṇe aññindriyassa saddhi indriyam adhimokkha parivāram hoti vīriya indriya  paggaha parivāram hoti satindriyam upaṭṭhāna parivāram hoti samādhindriyam avikkhepa parivāram
translated: At the moment of fruition of Stream-Entry, the faith faculty of the faculty of final knowledge has resolution as its attendant, the energy faculty has🔽exertion as its attendant, the mindfulness faculty has establishment as its attendant, the concentration faculty has non-distraction as its attendant,

original: hoti, paññindriyaṁ dassanaparivāraṁ hoti, manindriyaṁ vijānanaparivāraṁ hoti, somanassindriyaṁ🔽abhisandanaparivāraṁ hoti, jīvitindriyaṁ pavattasantatādhipateyyaparivāraṁ hoti.
analyzed: hoti paññā indriyam dassana parivāram hoti manindriyam vijānana parivāram hoti somanassindriya  abhisandana parivāram hoti jīvita indriyam pavatta santata ādhipateyya parivāram hoti
translated: At the moment of fruition of Stream-Entry, the faith faculty of the faculty of final knowledge is surrounded by the surrounding of resolution, the energy faculty is surrounded by the surrounding of exertion, the mindfulness faculty is surrounded by the surrounding of establishment, the concentration faculty is surrounded by the surrounding of non-distraction,🔽the understanding faculty is surrounded by the surrounding of seeing, the mind faculty is surrounded by the surrounding of knowing, the happiness faculty is surrounded by the surrounding of satisfaction, the life faculty is surrounded by the surrounding of the predominance of the continuity.

original: Sotāpattiphalakkhaṇe jātā dhammā sabbeva abyākatā honti, ṭhapetvā cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ sabbeva anāsavā honti, sabbeva lokuttarā honti, sabbeva nibbānārammaṇā honti.
analyzed: sotāpatti phala khaṇe jātāḥ dhammāḥ sabbe iva abyākatāḥ honti ṭhapetvā citta samuṭṭhānam rūpam sabbe iva anāsavāḥ honti sabbe iva lokuttarāḥ honti sabbe iva nibbāna ārammaṇāḥ honti
translated: At the moment of fruition of Stream-Entry, the things that have arisen are all indeterminate, all are without pollutants, all are Supramundane, all have Nibbāna as their object.

original: Sotāpattiphalakkhaṇe aññindriyassa imāni aṭṭhindriyāni sahajātaparivārā honti, aññamaññaparivārā
analyzed: sotāpatti phala kkhaṇe aññindriyassa imāni aṭṭhindriyāni sahajāta parivārā honti aññamañña parivārā
translated: At the moment of fruition of Stream-Entry, these eight faculties of the faculty of final knowledge are surrounded by the surrounding of conascence, are surrounded by the surrounding of mutuality,

original: honti, nissayaparivārā honti, sampayuttaparivārā honti, sahagatā honti, sahajātā
analyzed: honti nissaya parivārāḥ honti sampayutta parivārāḥ honti sahagatāḥ honti sahajātā
translated: they are its conditions, they are its circumstantial causes, they are its companions, they are its associates,

analyzed: honti sa saṭṭhāḥ honti sampayuttāḥ honti
translated: they are its co-nascent factors, they are its conjoined factors, they are its related factors.

original: Teva tassa ākārā ceva honti parivārā ca.
analyzed: teva tassa ākārā ca iva honti parivārā ca
translated: These are its aspects and its circumstantial causes.

analyzed: sakadāgāmi magga kkhaṇe pe
translated: At the moment of the path of once-returning …

analyzed: sakadāgāmi pha lakkhaṇe pe
translated: at the moment of the fruition of once-returning …

analyzed: anāgāmi magga kkhaṇe pe
translated: at the moment of the path of non-returning …

analyzed: anāgāmi pha lakkhaṇe pe
translated: at the moment of the fruition of non-returning …

analyzed: arahatta magga kkhaṇe aññindriyassa saddhindriyam adhimokkha parivāram hoti pe
translated: at the moment of the path of arahantship, the faith faculty is surrounded by the faith power …

analyzed: jīvita indriyam pavatta santata ādhipateyya parivāram hoti
translated: the life faculty is surrounded by the life faculty’s dominance over the life continuum.

original: Arahattamaggakkhaṇe jātā dhammā ṭhapetvā cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ sabbeva kusalā honti,
analyzed: arahatta magga kkhaṇe jātāḥ dhammāḥ ṭhapetvā citta samuṭṭhānam rūpam sabbe eva kusalāḥ honti
translated: The wholesome thoughts that arise at the moment of the path of arahantship, apart from bodily and verbal form, are all wholesome,

original: sabbeva anāsavā honti, sabbeva niyyānikā honti, sabbeva apacayagāmino honti, sabbeva
analyzed: sabbe iva anāsavāḥ honti sabbe iva niyyānikāḥ honti sabbe iva apacaya gāminaḥ honti sabbe iva
translated: all are free from the influxes, all lead out , all lead to diminution ,

analyzed: lokuttarāḥ honti sabbe iva nibbāna ārammaṇāḥ honti
translated: all are supramundane, all have nibbāna as their object.

original: Arahattamaggakkhaṇe aññindriyassa imāni aṭṭhindriyāni sahajātaparivārā honti, aññamaññaparivārā🔽honti, nissayaparivārā honti, sampayuttaparivārā honti, sahagatā honti, sahajātā
analyzed: arahatta magga kkhaṇe aññindriyassa imāni aṭṭhindriyāni sahajāta parivārā honti aññamañña parivārā  honti nissaya parivārāḥ honti sampayutta parivārāḥ honti sahagatāḥ honti sahajātā
translated: At the moment of the Arahant path the eight faculties are the conascent and the postnascent conditions for the faculty of final knowledge.🔽They are the mutual, support, association, and inherence conditions for it. They are conascent,

analyzed: honti sa saṭṭhāḥ honti sampayuttāḥ honti
translated: conjoined, and associated with it.

original: Teva tassa ākārā ceva honti parivārā ca.
analyzed: teva tassa ākārā ca iva honti parivārā ca
translated: These are its modes and its entourage.

original: Arahattaphalakkhaṇe aññātāvindriyassa saddhindriyaṁ adhimokkhaparivāraṁ hoti, vīriyindriyaṁ🔽paggahaparivāraṁ hoti, satindriyaṁ upaṭṭhānaparivāraṁ hoti, samādhindriyaṁ avikkhepaparivāraṁ🔽hoti, paññindriyaṁ dassanaparivāraṁ hoti, manindriyaṁ vijānanaparivāraṁ hoti, somanassindriyaṁ
analyzed: arahatta phala kkhaṇe aññātāvindriyassa saddhi indriyam adhimokkha parivāram hoti vīriya indriya  paggaha parivāram hoti satindriyam upaṭṭhāna parivāram hoti samādhindriyam avikkhepa parivāram  hoti paññā indriyam dassana parivāram hoti manindriyam vijānana parivāram hoti somanassindriya
translated: At the moment of the Arahant fruit the faith faculty is the resolution condition for the faculty of final knowledge. The energy faculty is the

analyzed: abhisandana parivāram hoti jīvita indriyam pavatta santata ādhipateyya parivāram hoti
translated: exertion condition for it. The mindfulness faculty is the establishment condition for it. The concentration faculty is the non-distraction condition for it. The understanding faculty is the seeing condition for it. The mind faculty is the perceiving condition for it. The joy faculty is the gladdening condition for it. The life faculty is the life-continuum condition for it.

original: Arahattaphalakkhaṇe jātā dhammā sabbeva abyākatā honti, ṭhapetvā cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ sabbeva anāsavā honti, sabbeva lokuttarā honti, sabbeva nibbānārammaṇā honti.
analyzed: arahatta phala khaṇe jātāḥ dhammāḥ sabbe iva abyākatāḥ honti ṭhapetvā citta samuṭṭhānam rūpam sabbe iva anāsavāḥ honti sabbe iva lokuttarāḥ honti sabbe iva nibbāna ārammaṇāḥ honti
translated: At the moment of the fruition of Arahantship, all the ideas that have arisen are indeterminate, all except for the materiality originated by consciousness are free from cankers, all are supramundane, all have Nibbāna as their object.

original: Arahattaphalakkhaṇe aññātāvindriyassa imāni aṭṭhindriyāni sahajātaparivārā honti,
analyzed: arahatta phala kkhaṇe aññātāvindriyassa imāni aṭṭhindriyāni sahajāta parivārā honti
translated: At the moment of the fruition of Arahantship, these eight faculties are associated with the faculty of final knowledge,

original: aññamaññaparivārā honti, nissayaparivārā honti, sampayuttaparivārā honti, sahagatā
analyzed: aññamañña parivārāḥ honti nissaya parivārāḥ honti sampayutta parivārāḥ honti sahagatā
translated: they are reciprocally associated, they are causally associated, they are conascent,

original: honti, sahajātā honti, saṁsaṭṭhā honti, sampayuttā honti.
analyzed: honti sahajātāḥ honti sa saṭṭhāḥ honti sampayuttāḥ honti
translated: they are conjoined, they are associated, they are mixed, they are mingled.

original: Teva tassa ākārā ceva honti parivārā ca.
analyzed: teva tassa ākārā ca iva honti parivārā ca
translated: These are its modes and its accompaniments.

analyzed: iti imāni aṭṭhaṭṭhakāni honti
translated: So these eight sets of eight make sixty-four.

analyzed: āsavā ati katame te āsavā
translated: As to “cankers”: what are cankers?

analyzed: kāma āsavaḥ bhava āsavaḥ diṭṭha āsavaḥ avijja āsavaḥ
translated: The canker of sense desire, the canker of becoming, the canker of views, the canker of ignorance.

analyzed: kattha ite āsavāḥ khīyanti
translated: At what moment do these cankers die out?

original: Sotāpattimaggena anavaseso diṭṭhāsavo khīyati, apāyagamanīyo kāmāsavo khīyati, apāyagamanīyo bhavāsavo khīyati, apāyagamanīyo avijjāsavo khīyati.
analyzed: sotāpatti maggena anavasesaḥ diṭṭha āsavaḥ khīyati apāya gamanīyaḥ kāma āsavaḥ khīyati apāya gamanīyaḥ bhava āsavaḥ khīyati apāya gamanīyaḥ avijjā āsavaḥ khīyati
translated: With the stream-entry path the entire effluent of views is eliminated, the effluent of sensual desire that leads to the states of deprivation is eliminated, the effluent of being that leads to the states of deprivation is eliminated, the effluent of ignorance that leads to the states of deprivation is eliminated.

analyzed: ettha ite āsavāḥ khīyanti
translated: These effluents are eliminated.

original: Sakadāgāmimaggena oḷāriko kāmāsavo khīyati, tadekaṭṭho bhavāsavo khīyati, tadekaṭṭho avijjāsavo khīyati.
analyzed: sakadāgāmi maggena oḷārikaḥ kāma āsavaḥ khīyati tad ekaṭṭhaḥ bhava āsavaḥ khīyati tad ekaṭṭhaḥ avijjā āsavaḥ khīyati
translated: With the once-return path the gross form of the effluent of sensual desire is eliminated, the gross form of the effluent of being is eliminated, the gross form of the effluent of ignorance is eliminated.

analyzed: ettha ite āsavāḥ khīyanti
translated: These effluents are eliminated.

original: Anāgāmimaggena anavaseso kāmāsavo khīyati, tadekaṭṭho bhavāsavo khīyati, tadekaṭṭho avijjāsavo khīyati.
analyzed: anāgāmi maggena anavasesaḥ kāma āsavaḥ khīyati tad ekaṭṭhaḥ bhava āsavaḥ khīyati tad ekaṭṭhaḥ avijjā āsavaḥ khīyati
translated: With the non-return path the entire effluent of sensual desire is eliminated, the gross form of the effluent of being is eliminated, the gross form of the effluent of ignorance is eliminated.

analyzed: ettha ite āsavāḥ khīyanti
translated: These effluents are eliminated.

original: Arahattamaggena anavaseso bhavāsavo khīyati, anavaseso avijjāsavo khīyati.
analyzed: arahatta maggena anavasesaḥ bhava āsavaḥ khīyati anavasesaḥ avijja āsavaḥ khīyati
translated: With the Arahant path the entire effluent of being is eliminated, the entire effluent of ignorance is eliminated.

analyzed: ettha ite āsavāḥ khīyanti
translated: These effluents are eliminated.

analyzed: tam ñāta ṭṭhena pajānana ṭṭhena paññā
translated: This is knowledge in the sense of recognition, understanding in the sense of discernment.

analyzed: tena vuccati
translated: Hence it was said:

original: “catusaṭṭhiyā ākārehi tiṇṇannaṁ indriyānaṁ vasibhāvatā paññā āsavānaṁ khaye ñāṇaṁ”.
analyzed: ākārehi tiṇṇannam indriyānam vasibhāvatā paññā āsavānam khaye ñāṇa
translated: “Understanding of the elimination of the effluents through mastery of the three faculties in sixty-four aspects is knowledge of the destruction of the effluents.”

analyzed: āsava kkhaya ñāṇa niddesaḥ pañcapaññāsamaḥ
translated: The Description of the Knowledge of the Destruction of the Taints is the fifty-fifth chapter.
THE TWO GROUPS OF FOUR ABOUT THE KNOWLEDGE OF THE TRUTHS

original: Kathaṁ pariññaṭṭhe paññā dukkhe ñāṇaṁ, pahānaṭṭhe paññā samudaye ñāṇaṁ, sacchikiriyaṭṭhe paññā nirodhe ñāṇaṁ, bhāvanaṭṭhe paññā magge ñāṇaṁ?
analyzed: katham pariñña ṭṭhe paññā dukkhe ñāṇa pahāna ṭṭhe paññā samudaye ñāṇa sacchikiriya ṭṭhe paññā nirodhe ñāṇa bhāvana ṭṭhe paññā magge ñāṇa
translated: How is it that understanding of the meaning of full-understanding is knowledge of suffering, understanding of the meaning of abandoning is knowledge of the origin, understanding of the meaning of realizing is knowledge of cessation, and understanding of the meaning of developing is knowledge of the path?

original: Dukkhassa pīḷanaṭṭho saṅkhataṭṭho santāpaṭṭho vipariṇāmaṭṭho pariññātaṭṭho;
analyzed: dukkhassa pīḷana ṭho saṅkhata ṭṭho santāpa ṭṭho vipariṇāma ṭho pariññāta ṭṭho
translated: The meaning of oppression in suffering, the meaning of being formed, the meaning of torment, the meaning of change, the meaning of full-understanding;

original: samudayassa āyūhanaṭṭho nidānaṭṭho saññogaṭṭho palibodhaṭṭho pahānaṭṭho;
analyzed: samudayassa āyūhana ṭho nidāna ṭho saññoga ṭṭho palibodha ṭṭho pahāna ṭṭho
translated: the meaning of accumulation in the origin, the meaning of source, the meaning of bond, the meaning of hindrance, the meaning of abandoning;

original: nirodhassa nissaraṇaṭṭho vivekaṭṭho asaṅkhataṭṭho amataṭṭho sacchikiriyaṭṭho;
analyzed: nirodhassa nissaraṇa ṭhaḥ viveka ṭṭhaḥ asaṅkhata ṭṭhaḥ amata ṭṭho sacchikiriya ṭṭho
translated: the meaning of escape in cessation, the meaning of seclusion, the meaning of being unformed, the meaning of deathless, the meaning of realizing;

original: maggassa niyyānaṭṭho hetuṭṭho dassanaṭṭho ādhipateyyaṭṭho bhāvanaṭṭho.
analyzed: maggassa niyyāna ṭhaḥ hetu ṭhaḥ dassana ṭhaḥ ādhipateyya ṭṭhaḥ bhāvana ṭhaḥ
translated: the meaning of outlet in the path, the meaning of cause, the meaning of seeing, the meaning of predominance, the meaning of developing.

original: Taṁ ñātaṭṭhena ñāṇaṁ, pajānanaṭṭhena paññā.🔽Tena vuccati—
analyzed: tam ñāta ṭṭhena pajānana ṭṭhena paññā 🔽tena vuccati
translated: That is knowledge in the sense of known, understanding in the sense of understanding.🔽Hence ‘understanding of the meaning of full-understanding … of developing is knowledge of the path’ was said.

original: “pariññaṭṭhe paññā dukkhe ñāṇaṁ, pahānaṭṭhe paññā samudaye ñāṇaṁ, sacchikiriyaṭṭhe paññā nirodhe ñāṇaṁ, bhāvanaṭṭhe paññā magge ñāṇaṁ”.
analyzed: pariñña ṭṭhe paññā dukkhe ñāṇa pahāna ṭṭhe paññā samudaye ñāṇa sacchikiriya ṭṭhe paññā nirodhe ñāṇa bhāvana ṭṭhe paññā magge ñāṇa
translated: “Understanding of the state of full understanding is knowledge of suffering, understanding of the state of giving up is knowledge of the origin of suffering, understanding of the state of ending is knowledge of the cessation of suffering, understanding of the state of realizing is knowledge of the path leading to the cessation of suffering.”🔽How is it knowledge of suffering, knowledge of the origin of suffering, knowledge of the cessation of suffering, knowledge of the path leading to the cessation of suffering?

original: Kathaṁ dukkhe ñāṇaṁ, dukkhasamudaye ñāṇaṁ, dukkhanirodhe ñāṇaṁ, dukkhanirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya ñāṇaṁ?🔽Maggasamaṅgissa ñāṇaṁ dukkhepetaṁ ñāṇaṁ, dukkhasamudayepetaṁ ñāṇaṁ, dukkhanirodhepetaṁ ñāṇaṁ, dukkhanirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāyapetaṁ ñāṇaṁ.
analyzed: katham dukkhe ñāṇa dukkha samudaye ñāṇa dukkha nirodhe ñāṇa dukkha nirodha gāminiyā paṭipadāya ñāṇa  magga samaṅgissa ñāṇam dukkhe petam ñāṇa dukkha samudaye petam ñāṇa dukkha nirodhe petam ñāṇa dukkha nirodha gāminiyā paṭipadāya petam ñāṇa
translated: Knowledge of one who possesses the path is knowledge of suffering, knowledge of the origin of suffering, knowledge of the cessation of suffering, knowledge of the path leading to the cessation of suffering.

analyzed: tattha kataman dukkhe ñāṇa
translated: Herein, what is knowledge of suffering?

original: Dukkhaṁ ārabbha yā uppajjati paññā pajānanā vicayo pavicayo dhammavicayo sallakkhaṇā
analyzed: dukkham ārabbha yā uppajjati paññā pajānanā vicayaḥ pavicayaḥ dhamma vicayaḥ sallakkhaṇā
translated: The understanding, the act of understanding, the state of understanding, the ability to understand, the being understood, the fact of being understood, that arises dependent on suffering,

original: upalakkhaṇā paccupalakkhaṇā paṇḍiccaṁ kosallaṁ nepuññaṁ vebhabyā cintā upaparikkhā🔽bhūri medhā pariṇāyikā vipassanā sampajaññaṁ patodo paññā paññindriyaṁ paññābalaṁ
analyzed: upalakkhaṇā paccupalakkhaṇā paṇḍiccam kosallam nepuññam vebhabyā cintā upaparikkhā 🔽bhūri medhā pariṇāyikā vipassanā sampajaññam patodaḥ paññā paññindriyam paññā bala
translated: the act of understanding, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood, the act of being understood,

original: paññāsatthaṁ paññāpāsādo paññāāloko paññāobhāso paññāpajjoto paññāratanaṁ amoho dhammavicayo sammādiṭṭhi—
analyzed: paññāsattham paññāpāsādo paññāāloko paññāobhāso paññā pajjoto paññāratanam amoho dhammavicayo sammādiṭṭhi
translated: The sword of wisdom, the palace of wisdom, the light of wisdom, the radiance of wisdom, the flame of wisdom, the jewel of wisdom, non-delusion, investigation of phenomena, right view—

analyzed: idam vuccati dukkhe ñāṇa  dukkha samudayaṃ ārabbha pe
translated: this is called knowledge of suffering.🔽With regard to the origin of suffering …

analyzed: dukkha nirodhaṃ ārabbha pe
translated: With regard to the cessation of suffering …

original: dukkhanirodhagāminiṁ paṭipadaṁ ārabbha yā uppajjati paññā pajānanā …pe… amoho dhammavicayo sammādiṭṭhi—
analyzed: dukkha nirodha gāminim paṭipadam ārabbha yā uppajjati paññā pajānanā pe amohaḥ dhamma vicayo sammādiṭṭhi
translated: With regard to the practice leading to the cessation of suffering, the wisdom, the act of fathoming, the act of penetrating … non-delusion, investigation of phenomena, right view—

analyzed: idam vuccati dukkha nirodha gāminiyā paṭipadāya ñāṇa
translated: this is called knowledge of the practice leading to the cessation of suffering.

analyzed: tam ñāta ṭṭhena pajānana ṭṭhena paññā
translated: It is knowledge in the sense of known, and it is understanding in the sense of fathoming.

analyzed: tena vuccati
translated: Thus it is said:

original: “dukkhe ñāṇaṁ, dukkhasamudaye ñāṇaṁ, dukkhanirodhe ñāṇaṁ, dukkhanirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya ñāṇaṁ”.
analyzed: dukkhe ñāṇa dukkha samudaye ñāṇa dukkha nirodhe ñāṇa dukkha nirodha gāminiyā paṭipadāya ñāṇa
translated: “Knowledge of suffering, knowledge of the origin of suffering, knowledge of the cessation of suffering, knowledge of the practice leading to the cessation of suffering.”

analyzed: saccañāṇa catukka dvaya niddeso tesaṭṭhimo
translated: The explanation of the two tetrads on the four kinds of knowledge of the truths is the sixteenth section.
The explanation of the knowledge of the four discriminations

original: Kathaṁ atthapaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ, dhammapaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ, niruttipaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ, paṭibhānapaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ?
analyzed: katham attha paṭisambhide ñāṇa dhamma paṭisambhide ñāṇa nirutti paṭisambhide ñāṇa paṭibhāna paṭisambhide ñāṇa
translated: What is knowledge of the discrimination of meaning, of the discrimination of truth, of the discrimination of language, and of the discrimination of perspicuity?

original: Atthesu ñāṇaṁ atthapaṭisambhidā, dhammesu ñāṇaṁ dhammapaṭisambhidā, niruttīsu ñāṇaṁ niruttipaṭisambhidā, paṭibhānesu ñāṇaṁ paṭibhānapaṭisambhidā.
analyzed: atthesu ñāṇam attha paṭisambhidā dhammesu ñāṇam dhamma paṭisambhidā niruttīsu ñāṇam nirutti paṭisambhidā paṭibhānesu ñāṇam paṭibhāna paṭisambhidā
translated: Knowledge of meanings is the discrimination of meaning. Knowledge of mental objects is the discrimination of mental objects. Knowledge of language is the discrimination of language. Knowledge of inspired speech is the discrimination of inspired speech.

original: Atthanānatte paññā atthapaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ, dhammanānatte paññā dhammapaṭisambhide🔽ñāṇaṁ, niruttinānatte paññā niruttipaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ, paṭibhānanānatte paññā paṭibhānapaṭisambhide🔽ñāṇaṁ, atthavavatthāne paññā atthapaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ, dhammavavatthāne paññā dhammapaṭisambhide
analyzed: attha nānatte paññā attha paṭisambhide ñāṇa dhamma nānatte paññā dhamma paṭisambhide  ñāṇa nirutti nānatte paññā nirutti paṭisambhide ñāṇa paṭibhāna nānatte paññā paṭibhāna paṭisambhide  ñāṇa attha vavatthāne paññā attha paṭisambhide ñāṇa dhamma vavatthāne paññā dhamma paṭisambhide
translated: Understanding of the variety of meanings is knowledge of the discrimination of meaning. Understanding of the variety of mental objects is knowledge of the discrimination of mental objects. Understanding of the variety of language is knowledge of the discrimination of language. Understanding of the variety of inspired speech is knowledge of the discrimination of inspired speech.🔽Understanding of the definition of meanings is knowledge of the discrimination of meaning. Understanding of the definition of mental objects is knowledge of the discrimination of mental objects. Understanding of the definition of language is knowledge of the discrimination of language. Understanding of the definition of inspired speech is knowledge of the discrimination of inspired speech.

original: ñāṇaṁ niruttivavatthāne paññā niruttipaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ, paṭibhānavavatthāne paññā🔽paṭibhānapaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ.
analyzed: ñāṇam nirutti vavatthāne paññā nirutti paṭisambhide ñāṇa paṭibhāna vavatthāne paññā  paṭibhāna paṭisambhide ñāṇa
translated: Understanding of the analysis of meanings is knowledge of the discrimination of meaning. Understanding of the analysis of mental objects is knowledge of the discrimination of mental objects. Understanding of the analysis of language is knowledge of the discrimination of language. Understanding of the analysis of inspired speech is knowledge of the discrimination of inspired speech.

original: Atthasallakkhaṇe paññā atthapaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ, dhammasallakkhaṇe paññā dhammapaṭisambhide
analyzed: attha sallakkhaṇe paññā attha paṭisambhide ñāṇa dhamma sallakkhaṇe paññā dhamma paṭisambhide
translated: Understanding of the investigation of meanings is knowledge of the discrimination of meaning. Understanding of the investigation of mental objects is knowledge of the discrimination of mental objects.

original: ñāṇaṁ, niruttisallakkhaṇe paññā niruttipaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ, paṭibhānasallakkhaṇe paññā🔽paṭibhānapaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ.
analyzed: ñāṇa nirutti sallakkhaṇe paññā nirutti paṭisambhide ñāṇa paṭibhāna sallakkhaṇe paññā  paṭibhāna paṭisambhide ñāṇa
translated: Understanding of the analysis of inspired speech is knowledge of the discrimination of inspired speech.

original: Atthūpalakkhaṇe paññā atthapaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ, dhammūpalakkhaṇe paññā dhammapaṭisambhide
analyzed: atthu upalakkhaṇe paññā attha paṭisambhide ñāṇa dhamma upalakkhaṇe paññā dhamma paṭisambhide
translated: Understanding of the investigation of meaning is knowledge of the discrimination of meaning. Understanding of the investigation of the Dhamma is knowledge of the discrimination of the Dhamma.

original: ñāṇaṁ, niruttūpalakkhaṇe paññā niruttipaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ, paṭibhānūpalakkhaṇe paññā🔽paṭibhānapaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ.
analyzed: ñāṇa niruttu upalakkhaṇe paññā nirutti paṭisambhide ñāṇa paṭibhāna upalakkhaṇe paññā  paṭibhāna paṭisambhide ñāṇa
translated: Understanding of the investigation of language is knowledge of the discrimination of language. Understanding of the investigation of inspired speech is knowledge of the discrimination of inspired speech.

original: Atthappabhede paññā atthapaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ, dhammappabhede paññā dhammapaṭisambhide🔽ñāṇaṁ, niruttippabhede paññā niruttipaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ, paṭibhānappabhede paññā paṭibhānapaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ.
analyzed: attha ppabhede paññā attha paṭisambhide ñāṇa dhamma ppabhede paññā dhamma paṭisambhide  ñāṇa nirutti ppabhede paññā nirutti paṭisambhide ñāṇa paṭibhāna ppabhede paññā paṭibhāna paṭisambhide ñāṇa
translated: Understanding of the categories of meaning is knowledge of the discrimination of meaning. Understanding of the categories of the Dhamma is knowledge of the discrimination of the Dhamma.🔽Understanding of the categories of language is knowledge of the discrimination of language. Understanding of the categories of inspired speech is knowledge of the discrimination of inspired speech.

original: Atthappabhāvane paññā atthapaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ, dhammappabhāvane paññā dhammapaṭisambhide
analyzed: attha ppabhāvane paññā attha paṭisambhide ñāṇa dhamma ppabhāvane paññā dhamma paṭisambhide
translated: Understanding of the development of meaning is knowledge of the discrimination of meaning. Understanding of the development of the Dhamma is knowledge of the discrimination of the Dhamma.

original: ñāṇaṁ, niruttippabhāvane paññā niruttipaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ, paṭibhānappabhāvane paññā
analyzed: ñāṇa nirutti ppabhāvane paññā nirutti paṭisambhide ñāṇa paṭibhāna ppabhāvane paññā
translated: Understanding of the development of language is knowledge of the discrimination of language. Understanding of the development of inspired speech is knowledge of the discrimination of inspired speech.

analyzed: paṭibhāna paṭisambhide ñāṇa
translated: Understanding of the discernment of expression is knowledge.

original: Atthajotane paññā atthapaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ, dhammajotane paññā dhammapaṭisambhide🔽ñāṇaṁ, niruttijotane paññā niruttipaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ, paṭibhānajotane paññā paṭibhānapaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ.
analyzed: attha jotane paññā attha paṭisambhide ñāṇa dhamma jotane paññā dhamma paṭisambhide  ñāṇa nirutti jotane paññā nirutti paṭisambhide ñāṇa paṭibhāna jotane paññā paṭibhāna paṭisambhide ñāṇa
translated: Understanding of the illumination of meaning is knowledge of the discernment of meaning, understanding of the illumination of ideas is knowledge of the discernment of ideas,🔽understanding of the illumination of language is knowledge of the discernment of language, understanding of the illumination of inspired speech is knowledge of the discernment of inspired speech.

original: Atthavirocane paññā atthapaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ, dhammavirocane paññā dhammapaṭisambhide🔽ñāṇaṁ, niruttivirocane paññā niruttipaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ, paṭibhānavirocane paññā paṭibhānapaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ.
analyzed: attha virocane paññā attha paṭisambhide ñāṇa dhamma virocane paññā dhamma paṭisambhide  ñāṇa nirutti virocane paññā nirutti paṭisambhide ñāṇa paṭibhāna virocane paññā paṭibhāna paṭisambhide ñāṇa
translated: Understanding of the manifestation of meaning is knowledge of the discernment of meaning, understanding of the manifestation of ideas is knowledge of the discernment of ideas,🔽understanding of the manifestation of language is knowledge of the discernment of language, understanding of the manifestation of inspired speech is knowledge of the discernment of inspired speech.

original: Atthappakāsane paññā atthapaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ, dhammappakāsane paññā dhammapaṭisambhide
analyzed: attha ppakāsane paññā attha paṭisambhide ñāṇa dhamma ppakāsane paññā dhamma paṭisambhide
translated: Understanding of the revelation of meaning is knowledge of the discernment of meaning, understanding of the revelation of ideas is knowledge of the discernment of ideas,

original: ñāṇaṁ, niruttippakāsane paññā niruttipaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ, paṭibhānappakāsane paññā🔽paṭibhānapaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ.
analyzed: ñāṇa nirutti pakāsane paññā nirutti paṭisambhide ñāṇa paṭibhāna pakāsane paññā  paṭibhāna paṭisambhide ñāṇa
translated: understanding of the revelation of language is knowledge of the discernment of language, understanding of the revelation of inspired speech is knowledge of the discernment of inspired speech.🔽Understanding of the manifestation of inspired speech is knowledge of the discernment of inspired speech.🔽That is knowledge, understanding, insight, wisdom, deeper insight, emancipation,

analyzed: tam ñāta ṭṭhena pajānana ṭṭhena paññā
translated: and discernment.

analyzed: tena vuccati
translated: That is why it is said:

original: “atthapaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ, dhammapaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ, niruttipaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ, paṭibhānapaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ”.
analyzed: attha paṭisambhide ñāṇa dhamma paṭisambhide ñāṇa nirutti paṭisambhide ñāṇa paṭibhāna paṭisambhide ñāṇa
translated: “The knowledge of the discernment of meaning, the knowledge of the discernment of truth, the knowledge of the discernment of language, the knowledge of the discernment of inspired speech.”

analyzed: suddhika paṭisambhidā ñāṇa niddesaḥ sattasaṭṭhimaḥ
translated: The seventh section on the knowledge of discernment in its entirety.
… The knowledge of the higher and lower faculties

original: Katamaṁ tathāgatassa indriyaparopariyattañāṇaṁ?🔽Idha tathāgato satte passati apparajakkhe mahārajakkhe tikkhindriye mudindriye svākāre
analyzed: katamam tathāgatassa  idha tathāgataḥ satte passati apparajakkhe mahārajakkhe tikkhindriye mudindriye su ākāre
translated: What is the Realised One’s knowledge of the higher and lower faculties?

original: dvākāre suviññāpaye duviññāpaye appekacce paralokavajjabhayadassāvino appekacce na🔽paralokavajjabhayadassāvino.🔽Apparajakkhe mahārajakkheti saddho puggalo apparajakkho, assaddho puggalo mahārajakkho.🔽Āraddhavīriyo puggalo apparajakkho, kusīto puggalo mahārajakkho.
analyzed: dvi ākāre su viññāpaye du viññāpaye appekacce para loka vajja bhaya dassāvinaḥ appekacce na  para loka vajja bhaya dassāvinaḥ  apparajakkhe mahārajakkhe iti saddhaḥ puggalaḥ apparajakkhaḥ assaddhaḥ puggalaḥ mahārajakkhaḥ  āraddha vīriyaḥ puggalaḥ apparajakkhaḥ kusītaḥ puggalaḥ mahārajakkhaḥ
translated: Here the Realised One sees beings with little dust on the eyes, with much dust on the eyes, with keen faculties, with undeveloped faculties, with good conditions, with poor conditions, with good dispositions, with poor dispositions, easy to instruct, hard to instruct, and only requiring slight guidance in order to run along well.🔽Some see danger in what is dangerous, and some do not see danger in what is dangerous.🔽Some see safety in what is safe, and some do not see safety in what is safe.🔽Those with little dust on the eyes are those with faith, those with much dust on the eyes are those without faith.🔽Those with little dust on the eyes are those with energy, those with much dust on the eyes are those without energy.

original: Upaṭṭhitassati puggalo apparajakkho, muṭṭhassati puggalo mahārajakkho.
analyzed: upaṭṭhitaḥ ati puggalaḥ apparajakkhaḥ muṭṭhaḥ ati puggalaḥ mahārajakkhaḥ
translated: Those with little dust on the eyes are those with mindfulness, those with much dust on the eyes are those without mindfulness.

original: Samāhito puggalo apparajakkho, asamāhito puggalo mahārajakkho.
analyzed: samāhitaḥ puggalaḥ apparajakkhaḥ asamāhitaḥ puggalaḥ mahārajakkhaḥ
translated: The concentrated person is the one with little dust on his eyes; the unconcentrated person is the one with much dust on his eyes.

original: Paññavā puggalo apparajakkho, duppañño puggalo mahārajakkho.
analyzed: paññavā puggalaḥ apparajakkhaḥ duppaññaḥ puggalaḥ mahārajakkhaḥ
translated: The wise person is the one with little dust on his eyes; the unwise person is the one with much dust on his eyes.

original: Tikkhindriye mudindriyeti saddho puggalo tikkhindriyo, assaddho puggalo mudindriyo.🔽Āraddhavīriyo puggalo tikkhindriyo, kusīto puggalo mudindriyo.
analyzed: tikkhindriye mudindriye iti saddho puggalo tikkhindriyo assaddhaḥ puggalo mud indriyo  āraddha vīriyo puggalo tikkha indriyo kusīto puggalo mud indriyo
translated: The one with keen faculties is the one with keen faculties in the three trainings; the one with dull faculties is the one with dull faculties in the three trainings.🔽The energetic person is the one with keen faculties in the three trainings; the idle person is the one with dull faculties in the three trainings.

original: Upaṭṭhitassati puggalo tikkhindriyo, muṭṭhassati puggalo mudindriyo.
analyzed: upaṭṭhitaḥ sati puggalo tikkha indriyaḥ muṭṭhaḥ sati puggalo mud indriyaḥ
translated: The mindful person is the one with keen faculties in the three trainings; the heedless person is the one with dull faculties in the three trainings.

original: Samāhito puggalo tikkhindriyo, asamāhito puggalo mudindriyo.🔽Paññavā puggalo tikkhindriyo, duppañño puggalo mudindriyo.
analyzed: samāhitaḥ puggalo tikkha indriyaḥ asamāhitaḥ puggalo mud indriyaḥ  paññavā puggalaḥ tikkha indriyaḥ duppaññaḥ puggalaḥ mud indriyaḥ
translated: The concentrated person is the one with keen faculties in the three trainings; the unconcentrated person is the one with dull faculties in the three trainings.🔽The wise person is the one with keen faculties in the three trainings; the unwise person is the one with dull faculties in the three trainings.

original: Svākāre dvākāreti saddho puggalo svākāro, assaddho puggalo dvākāro.🔽Āraddhavīriyo puggalo svākāro, kusīto puggalo dvākāro.
analyzed: su ākāre dvi ākāre iti saddho puggalo su ākāro assaddho puggalo dvi ākāro  āraddha vīriyo puggalo su ākāro kusīto puggalo dvi ākāro
translated: The one with good conduct is the one with good conduct in the two; the one with bad conduct is the one with bad conduct in the two.🔽The energetic person is the one with good conduct in the two; the idle person is the one with bad conduct in the two.

original: Upaṭṭhitassati puggalo svākāro, muṭṭhassati puggalo dvākāro.
analyzed: upaṭṭhitaḥ sati puggalo su ākāro muṭṭhaḥ sati puggalo dvi ākāro
translated: The mindful person is the one with good conduct in the two; the heedless person is the one with bad conduct in the two.

original: Samāhito puggalo svākāro, asamāhito puggalo dvākāro.
analyzed: samāhito puggalo su ākāraḥ asamāhito puggalo dvi ākāro
translated: The concentrated person is the one with good conduct in the two; the unconcentrated person is the one with bad conduct in the two.

original: Paññavā puggalo svākāro, duppañño puggalo dvākāro.🔽Suviññāpaye duviññāpayeti saddho puggalo suviññāpayo, assaddho puggalo duviññāpayo.
analyzed: paññavā puggalo su ākāraḥ duppaññaḥ puggalo dvi ākāro  su viññāpaye du viññāpaye iti saddhaḥ puggalo su viññāpayaḥ assaddhaḥ puggalo du viññāpayaḥ
translated: The wise person is easy to admonish; the ignorant person is difficult to admonish.🔽The faithful person is easy to admonish; the faithless person is difficult to admonish.

original: Āraddhavīriyo puggalo suviññāpayo, kusīto puggalo duviññāpayo.🔽Upaṭṭhitassati puggalo suviññāpayo, muṭṭhassati puggalo duviññāpayo.
analyzed: āraddha vīriyo puggalo su viññāpayo kusīto puggalo du viññāpayo  upaṭṭhitassati puggalo su viññāpayo muṭṭhassati puggalo du viññāpayo
translated: The energetic person is easy to admonish; the idle person is difficult to admonish.🔽The mindful person is easy to admonish; the heedless person is difficult to admonish.

original: Samāhito puggalo suviññāpayo, asamāhito puggalo duviññāpayo.
analyzed: samāhito puggalo su viññāpayo asamāhito puggalo du viññāpayo
translated: The concentrated person is easy to admonish; the unconcentrated person is difficult to admonish.

original: Paññavā puggalo suviññāpayo, duppañño puggalo duviññāpayo.🔽Appekacce paralokavajjabhayadassāvino, appekacce na paralokavajjabhayadassāvinoti saddho puggalo paralokavajjabhayadassāvī, assaddho puggalo na paralokavajjabhayadassāvī.
analyzed: paññavā puggalo su viññāpayo duppaññaḥ puggalo du viññāpayo  appekacce paraloka vajja bhaya dassāvino appekacce na paraloka vajja bhaya dassāvino ti saddho puggalo paraloka vajja bhaya dassāvī assaddhaḥ puggalo na paraloka vajja bhaya dassāvī
translated: The wise person is easy to admonish; the ignorant person is difficult to admonish.🔽Some see fear in the next world because of what is evil and unwholesome; some do not see fear in the next world because of what is evil and unwholesome. The faithful person sees fear in the next world because of what is evil and unwholesome; the faithless person does not see fear in the next world because of what is evil and unwholesome.

original: Āraddhavīriyo puggalo paralokavajjabhayadassāvī, kusīto puggalo na paralokavajjabhayadassāvī.
analyzed: āraddha vīriyo puggalo paraloka vajja bhaya dassāvī kusītaḥ puggalo na paraloka vajja bhaya dassāvī
translated: The energetic person sees fear in the next world because of what is evil and unwholesome; the idle person does not see fear in the next world because of what is evil and unwholesome.

original: Upaṭṭhitassati puggalo paralokavajjabhayadassāvī, muṭṭhassati puggalo na paralokavajjabhayadassāvī.🔽Samāhito puggalo paralokavajjabhayadassāvī, asamāhito puggalo na paralokavajjabhayadassāvī.
analyzed: upaṭṭhitaḥ sati puggalo para loka vajja bhaya dassāvī muṭṭhaḥ sati puggalo na para loka vajja bhaya dassāvī  samāhitaḥ puggalo para loka vajja bhaya dassāvī asamāhitaḥ puggalaḥ na para loka vajja bhaya dassāvī
translated: One who is mindful sees the danger in the next world, while one who is heedless does not see the danger in the next world.🔽One who is concentrated sees the danger in the next world, while one who is not concentrated does not see the danger in the next world.

original: Paññavā puggalo paralokavajjabhayadassāvī, duppañño puggalo na paralokavajjabhayadassāvī.
analyzed: paññavā puggalo para loka vajja bhaya dassāvī duppaññaḥ puggalaḥ na para loka vajja bhaya dassāvī
translated: One who is wise sees the danger in the next world, while one who is unwise does not see the danger in the next world.

analyzed: loka uti
translated: The world:
