original: Vajjanti sabbe kilesā vajjā, sabbe duccaritā vajjā, sabbe abhisaṅkhārā vajjā, sabbe bhavagāmikammā vajjā.
analyzed: vajjanti sabbe kilesāḥ vajjā sabbe duccaritāḥ vajjā sabbe abhisaṅkhārāḥ vajjā sabbe bhava gāmi kammāḥ vajjā
translated: All defilements are a danger, all bad actions are a danger, all volitions are a danger, all deeds that lead to existence are a danger.

original: Iti imasmiñca loke imasmiñca vajje tibbā bhayasaññā paccupaṭṭhitā hoti, seyyathāpi ukkhittāsike vadhake.
analyzed: iti imasmin ca loke imasmin ca vajje tibbā bhaya saññā paccupaṭṭhitā hoti seyyathā api ukkhitta asike vadhake
translated: Thus, in regard to this world and this danger, the perception of danger is present to him as if he were a person who had a drawn sword.🔽In these fifty ways he knows and sees these five faculties.

original: Imehi paññāsāya ākārehi imāni pañcindriyāni jānāti passati aññāti paṭivijjhati—🔽idaṁ tathāgatassa indriyaparopariyattañāṇaṁ.
analyzed: imehi paññāsāya ākārehi imāni pañca indriyāni jānāti passati aññāti paṭivijjhati  idam tathāgatassa
translated: This is the Realised One’s knowledge of the degree of spiritual faculties of other beings.

analyzed: indriya para upari yatta ñāṇa niddesaḥ aṭṭhasaṭṭhimaḥ
translated: The explanation of the knowledge of the degree of spiritual faculties is finished.

analyzed: āsaya anusaya ñāṇa niddesa
translated: ... The explanation of the knowledge of the inclinations and latent tendencies of beings

analyzed: katamam tathāgatassa sattānam āsaya anusaye ñāṇa
translated: What is the Realised One’s knowledge of the inclinations and latent tendencies of beings?

original: Idha tathāgato sattānaṁ āsayaṁ jānāti, anusayaṁ jānāti, caritaṁ jānāti, adhimuttiṁ jānāti, bhabbābhabbe satte pajānāti.
analyzed: idha tathāgataḥ sattānam āsayam jānāti anusayam jānāti caritam jānāti adhimuttim jānāti bhabba abhabbe satte pajānāti
translated: Here the Realised One knows the inclination of beings, he knows the latent tendency of beings, he knows the conduct of beings, he knows the faculties of beings, he knows beings of little dust and beings of much dust.

analyzed: katamaḥ sattānam āsayaḥ
translated: What is the inclination of beings?

original: “Sassato loko”ti vā, “asassato loko”ti vā, “antavā loko”ti vā, “anantavā loko”ti🔽vā, “taṁ jīvaṁ taṁ sarīran”ti vā, “aññaṁ jīvaṁ aññaṁ sarīran”ti vā, “hoti tathāgato🔽paraṁ maraṇā”ti vā, “na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā”ti vā, “hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato
analyzed: sassataḥ loko ti vā a sassataḥ loko ti vā antavā loko ti vā anantavā lokoti  vā tam jīvam tam sarīranti vā aññam jīvam aññam sarīranti vā hoti tathāgato  param vā na hoti tathāgato param vā hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato
translated: ‘The world is eternal’ or ‘The world is not eternal’; ‘The world is finite’ or ‘The world is infinite’;🔽‘The soul is the same as the body’ or ‘The soul is one thing and the body another’;

original: paraṁ maraṇā”ti vā, “neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā”ti vā.
analyzed: param maraṇāti vā na iva hoti na na hoti tathāgataḥ param maraṇāti vā
translated: ‘After death a Tathāgata exists’ or ‘After death a Tathāgata does not exist’ or ‘After death a Tathāgata both exists and does not exist’ or ‘After death a Tathāgata neither exists nor does not exist.’

original: Iti bhavadiṭṭhisannissitā vā sattā honti vibhavadiṭṭhisannissitā vā.
analyzed: iti bhava diṭṭhi sannissitāḥ vā sattāḥ honti vibhava diṭṭhi sannissitāḥ vā
translated: Beings are dependent on views like these, or on the view that there is no cause, or on the view that the cause is a permanent being.

original: Ete vā pana ubho ante anupagamma idappaccayatāpaṭiccasamuppannesu dhammesu anulomikā khanti paṭiladdhā hoti, yathābhūtaṁ vā ñāṇaṁ.🔽Kāmaṁ sevantaññeva jānāti—🔽“ayaṁ puggalo kāmagaruko kāmāsayo kāmādhimutto”ti.🔽Kāmaṁ sevantaññeva jānāti—
analyzed: ete vā pana ubho ante an upagamma idappaccaya tā paṭicca samuppannesu dhammesu anulomikā khanti paṭiladdhā hoti yathābhūtam vā ñāṇa  kāmam sevantam ñā iva jānāti  ayam puggalaḥ kāma garukaḥ kāma āsayaḥ kāma adhimuttaḥ ti  kāmam sevantam ñā iva jānāti
translated: But when one does not grasp at either of these extremes, but has a receptivity that accords with the way things are in regard to dependently arisen things, or has the knowledge of things as they really are,🔽one knows one who indulges in sensual pleasures as one who is dominated by sensual pleasures, as one who is addicted to sensual pleasures, as one who is bent on sensual pleasures.

analyzed: ayam puggalaḥ nekkhamma garukaḥ nekkhamma āsayaḥ nekkhamma adhimuttaḥ ti
translated: One knows one who is devoted to renunciation as one who is dominated by renunciation, as one who is addicted to renunciation, as one who is bent on renunciation.

analyzed: nekkhammam sevantañca eva jānāti
translated: He knows that one who pursues renunciation

analyzed: ayam puggalaḥ nekkhamma garukaḥ nekkhamma āsayaḥ nekkhamma adhimuttaḥ ti
translated: is devoted to renunciation, intent on renunciation, and committed to renunciation.

analyzed: nekkhammam sevantañca eva jānāti
translated: He knows that one who pursues renunciation

analyzed: ayam puggalaḥ kāma garukaḥ kāma āsayaḥ kāma adhimuttaḥ ti
translated: is devoted to sensuality, intent on sensuality, and committed to sensuality.

analyzed: byāpādam sevantam ñā iva jānāti
translated: He knows that one who pursues ill will

analyzed: ayam puggalaḥ byāpāda garukaḥ byāpāda āsayaḥ byāpāda adhimuttaḥ ti
translated: is devoted to ill will, intent on ill will, and committed to ill will.

analyzed: byāpādam sevantam ñā iva jānāti
translated: He knows that one who pursues ill will

analyzed: ayam puggalaḥ a byāpāda garukaḥ a byāpāda āsayaḥ a byāpāda adhimuttaḥ ti
translated: is devoted to non-ill will, intent on non-ill will, and committed to non-ill will.

analyzed: a byāpādam sevantam ña eva jānāti
translated: He knows that one who pursues non-ill will

analyzed: ayam puggalaḥ a byāpāda garukaḥ a byāpāda āsayaḥ a byāpāda adhimuttaḥ ti
translated: is devoted to non-ill will, intent on non-ill will, and committed to non-ill will.

analyzed: a byāpādam sevantam ña eva jānāti
translated: He knows that one who pursues non-ill will

analyzed: ayam puggalaḥ byāpāda garukaḥ byāpāda āsayaḥ byāpāda adhimuttaḥ ti
translated: is devoted to ill will, intent on ill will, and committed to ill will.

analyzed: thinam iddham sevantam ñā iva jānāti
translated: He knows that one who pursues restlessness and remorse

analyzed: ayam puggalaḥ thinam iddha garukaḥ thinam iddha āsayaḥ thinam iddha adhimuttaḥ ti
translated: is devoted to restlessness and remorse, intent on restlessness and remorse, and committed to restlessness and remorse.

analyzed: thinam iddham sevantam ñā iva jānāti
translated: He knows that one who pursues restlessness and remorse

analyzed: ayam puggalaḥ āloka saññā garukaḥ āloka saññā sayaḥ āloka saññā adhimuttaḥ ti
translated: ‘This person is devoted to the perception of light, is devoted to the practice of the perception of light, has immersed himself in the perception of light.’🔽He knows that one who is devoted to the perception of light🔽is devoted to the perception of light, is immersed in the perception of light, has immersed himself in the perception of light.

analyzed: āloka saññam sevantaññeva jānāti
translated: He knows that one who is devoted to the perception of light

analyzed: ayam puggalaḥ āloka saññā garukaḥ āloka saññā sayaḥ āloka saññā adhimuttaḥ ti
translated: is devoted to the perception of light, is immersed in the perception of light, has immersed himself in the perception of light.

original: Ālokasaññaṁ sevantaññeva jānāti—🔽“ayaṁ puggalo thinamiddhagaruko thinamiddhāsayo thinamiddhādhimutto”ti.
analyzed: āloka saññam sevantaññeva jānāti  ayam puggalaḥ thinam iddha garukaḥ thinam iddha āsayaḥ thinam iddha adhimuttaḥ ti
translated: He knows that one who is devoted to the perception of light🔽is devoted to the perception of light, is immersed in the perception of light, has immersed himself in the perception of light.

analyzed: ayam sattānam āsayo
translated: This is the disposition of beings.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca sattānam anusayaḥ
translated: What is the underlying tendency of beings?

analyzed: sattā anusayā
translated: There are seven underlying tendencies:

original: kāmarāgānusayo, paṭighānusayo, mānānusayo, diṭṭhānusayo, vicikicchānusayo, bhavarāgānusayo, avijjānusayo.🔽Yaṁ loke piyarūpaṁ sātarūpaṁ, ettha sattānaṁ kāmarāgānusayo anuseti.
analyzed: kāma rāga anusayo paṭigha anusayaḥ māna anusayaḥ diṭṭha anusayaḥ vicikicchā anusayaḥ bhava rāga anusayaḥ avijjā anusayaḥ  yam loke piya rūpam sāta rūpaḥ ettha sattānam kāma rāga anusayaḥ anuseti
translated: the underlying tendency to sensual desire, the underlying tendency to repulsion, the underlying tendency to pride, the underlying tendency to views, the underlying tendency to doubt, the underlying tendency to desire for being, and the underlying tendency to ignorance.🔽In regard to what is likable and agreeable in the world, the underlying tendency to sensual desire underlies it.

original: Yaṁ loke appiyarūpaṁ asātarūpaṁ, ettha sattānaṁ paṭighānusayo anuseti.
analyzed: yam loke appiya rūpam asāta rūpaḥ ettha sattānam paṭigha anusayaḥ anuseti
translated: In regard to what is unlikable and disagreeable in the world, the underlying tendency to repulsion underlies it.

original: Iti imesu dvīsu dhammesu avijjā anupatitā, tadekaṭṭho māno ca diṭṭhi ca vicikicchā ca daṭṭhabbā.
analyzed: iti imesu dvīsu dhammesu avijjā anupatitā tad ekaṭṭhaḥ māno ca diṭṭhi ca vicikicchā ca daṭṭhabbā
translated: And in regard to these two things, ignorance underlies it. And the conceit ‘I am’ and the view ‘I am’ should be seen as based on that.

analyzed: ayam sattānam anusayaḥ
translated: This is the underlying tendency in beings.

analyzed: katamat ca
translated: “And what is the practice in beings?

original: Puññābhisaṅkhāro apuññābhisaṅkhāro āneñjābhisaṅkhāro parittabhūmako vā mahābhūmako vā.
analyzed: puñña abhisaṅkhāraḥ apuñña abhisaṅkhāraḥ āneñja abhisaṅkhāraḥ paritta bhūmakaḥ vā mahā bhūmakaḥ vā
translated: There is the practice of creating merit, the practice of creating demerit, and the practice of creating the imperturbable.

analyzed: idam sattānam carita
translated: This is the practice in beings.

analyzed: katamā ca sattānam adhimutti
translated: “And what is the inclination in beings?

original: Santi sattā hīnādhimuttikā, santi sattā paṇītādhimuttikā.🔽Hīnādhimuttikā sattā hīnādhimuttike satte sevanti bhajanti payirupāsanti.
analyzed: santi sattā hīna adhimuttikā santi sattā paṇīta adhimuttikā  hīna adhimuttikā sattā hīna adhimuttike satte sevanti bhajanti payirupāsanti
translated: There are beings with a low inclination, and there are beings with a lofty inclination.🔽Beings with a low inclination associate with, attend upon, and venerate beings with a low inclination,

original: Paṇītādhimuttikā sattā paṇītādhimuttike satte sevanti bhajanti payirupāsanti.
analyzed: paṇīta adhimuttikā sattā paṇīta adhimuttike satte sevanti bhajanti payirupāsanti
translated: while beings with a lofty inclination associate with, attend upon, and venerate beings with a lofty inclination.

original: Atītampi addhānaṁ hīnādhimuttikā sattā hīnādhimuttike satte seviṁsu bhajiṁsu payirupāsiṁsu;
analyzed: atītam pi addhānam hīna adhimuttikā sattā hīna adhimuttike satte
translated: In the past, beings with a low inclination associated with, attended upon, and venerated beings with a low inclination,

original: paṇītādhimuttikā sattā paṇītādhimuttike satte seviṁsu bhajiṁsu payirupāsiṁsu.
analyzed: paṇīta adhimuttikā sattā paṇīta adhimuttike satte
translated: while beings with a lofty inclination associated with, attended upon, and venerated beings with a lofty inclination.

original: Anāgatampi addhānaṁ hīnādhimuttikā sattā hīnādhimuttike satte sevissanti bhajissanti payirupāsissanti;
analyzed: anāgatam pi addhānam hīna adhimuttikā sattā hīna adhimuttike satte sevissanti bhajissanti payirupāsissanti
translated: In the future, beings with a low inclination will associate with, attend upon, and venerate beings with a low inclination,

original: paṇītādhimuttikā sattā paṇītādhimuttike satte sevissanti bhajissanti payirupāsissanti.🔽Ayaṁ sattānaṁ adhimutti.
analyzed: paṇīta adhimuttikā sattā paṇīta adhimuttike satte sevissanti bhajissanti payirupāsissanti  ayam sattānam adhimutti
translated: Beings who are intent on the superior will associate with, attend on, and venerate beings who are intent on the superior.🔽This is the intent of beings.

analyzed: katame sattā abhabbā
translated: Which beings are incapable?

original: Ye te sattā kammāvaraṇena samannāgatā, kilesāvaraṇena samannāgatā, vipākāvaraṇena samannāgatā, assaddhā acchandikā duppaññā, abhabbā niyāmaṁ okkamituṁ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṁ—
analyzed: ye te sattā kamma āvaraṇena samannāgatā kilesa āvaraṇena samannāgatā vipāka āvaraṇena samannāgatā assaddhāḥ acchandikāḥ duppaññāḥ abhabbāḥ niyāmam okkamitum kusalesu dhammesu sammatta
translated: Those beings who are hindered by kamma, hindered by defilements, hindered by the results , who are without faith, without desire, and witout wisdom are incapable of entering the fixed course in wholesome qualities, the right path—

analyzed: ime te sattā abhabbā
translated: these beings are incapable.

analyzed: katame sattā bhabbā
translated: Which beings are capable?

original: Ye te sattā na kammāvaraṇena samannāgatā, na kilesāvaraṇena samannāgatā, na vipākāvaraṇena
analyzed: ye te sattā na kamma āvaraṇena samannāgatāḥ na kilesa āvaraṇena samannāgatāḥ na vipāka āvaraṇena
translated: Those beings who are not hindered by kamma, not hindered by defilements, not hindered by the results ,

original: samannāgatā, saddhā chandikā paññavanto, bhabbā niyāmaṁ okkamituṁ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṁ—
analyzed: samannāgatā saddhā chandikā paññavantaḥ bhabbāḥ niyāmam okkamitum kusalesu dhammesu
translated: who have faith, desire, and wisdom are capable of entering the fixed course in wholesome qualities, the right path—

analyzed: ime te sattā bhabbā
translated: these beings are capable.

original: Idaṁ tathāgatassa sattānaṁ āsayānusaye ñāṇaṁ.🔽Āsayānusayañāṇaniddeso navasaṭṭhimo.
analyzed: idam tathāgatassa sattānam āsaya anusaye ñāṇa  āsaya anusaya ñāṇa niddesaḥ navasaṭṭhimaḥ
translated: This is the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the dispositions and underlying tendencies of beings.

analyzed: yamaka pāṭihīra ñāṇa niddesa
translated: The description of the knowledge of the dispositions and underlying tendencies is the twenty-ninth chapter.

analyzed: katamam tathāgatassa yamaka pāṭihīre ñāṇa
translated: What is the Realised One’s knowledge of the Twin-Miracle?

original: Idha tathāgato yamakapāṭihīraṁ karoti asādhāraṇaṁ sāvakehi.🔽Uparimakāyato aggikkhandho pavattati, heṭṭhimakāyato udakadhārā pavattati;
analyzed: tathāgataḥ yamaka pāṭi hīram karoti asādhāraṇam  uparima kāyataḥ aggi kkhandho pavattati heṭṭhima kāyataḥ udaka dhārā pavattati
translated: Here the Realised One performs the Twin-Miracle which is not shared by disciples,🔽from the upper part of his body flames of fire blaze forth, and from the lower part of his body streams of water flow forth;

original: heṭṭhimakāyato aggikkhandho pavattati, uparimakāyato udakadhārā pavattati;🔽puratthimakāyato aggikkhandho pavattati, pacchimakāyato udakadhārā pavattati;
analyzed: heṭṭhima kāyataḥ aggi kkhandho pavattati uparima kāyataḥ udaka dhārā pavattati  puratthima kāyataḥ aggi kkhandho pavattati pacchima kāyataḥ udaka dhārā pavattati
translated: from the lower part of his body flames of fire blaze forth, and from the upper part of his body streams of water flow forth;🔽from the front part of his body flames of fire blaze forth, and from the back part of his body streams of water flow forth;

original: pacchimakāyato aggikkhandho pavattati, puratthimakāyato udakadhārā pavattati;🔽dakkhiṇaakkhito aggikkhandho pavattati, vāmaakkhito udakadhārā pavattati;🔽vāmaakkhito aggikkhandho pavattati, dakkhiṇaakkhito udakadhārā pavattati;
analyzed: pacchima kāyataḥ aggi kkhandho pavattati puratthima kāyataḥ udaka dhārā pavattati  dakkhiṇa akkhitaḥ aggi kkhandho pavattati vāma akkhitaḥ udaka dhārā pavattati  vāma akkhitaḥ aggi kkhandho pavattati dakkhiṇa akkhitaḥ udaka dhārā pavattati
translated: from the back part of his body flames of fire blaze forth, and from the front part of his body streams of water flow forth;🔽from his right eye flames of fire blaze forth, and from his left eye streams of water flow forth;🔽from his left eye flames of fire blaze forth, and from his right eye streams of water flow forth;

original: dakkhiṇakaṇṇasotato aggikkhandho pavattati, vāmakaṇṇasotato udakadhārā pavattati;
analyzed: dakkhiṇa kaṇṇa sotataḥ aggi kkhandho pavattati vāma kaṇṇa sotataḥ udaka dhārā pavattati
translated: from his right ear flames of fire blaze forth, and from his left ear streams of water flow forth;

original: vāmakaṇṇasotato aggikkhandho pavattati, dakkhiṇakaṇṇasotato udakadhārā pavattati;
analyzed: vāma kaṇṇa sotataḥ aggi kkhandho pavattati dakkhiṇa kaṇṇa sotataḥ udaka dhārā pavattati
translated: a flame comes out of his left ear and water comes out of his right ear;

original: dakkhiṇanāsikāsotato aggikkhandho pavattati, vāmanāsikāsotato udakadhārā pavattati;🔽vāmanāsikāsotato aggikkhandho pavattati, dakkhiṇanāsikāsotato udakadhārā pavattati;
analyzed: dakkhiṇa nāsikā sotataḥ aggi kkhandho pavattati vāma nāsikā sotataḥ udaka dhārā pavattati  vāma nāsikā sotataḥ aggi kkhandho pavattati dakkhiṇa nāsikā sotataḥ udaka dhārā pavattati
translated: a flame comes out of his right nostril and water comes out of his left nostril;🔽a flame comes out of his left nostril and water comes out of his right nostril;

original: dakkhiṇaaṁsakūṭato aggikkhandho pavattati, vāmaaṁsakūṭato udakadhārā pavattati;🔽vāmaaṁsakūṭato aggikkhandho pavattati, dakkhiṇaaṁsakūṭato udakadhārā pavattati;
analyzed: dakkhiṇa asakūṭataḥ aggi kkhandho pavattati vāma asakūṭataḥ udaka dhārā pavattati  vāma asakūṭataḥ aggi kkhandho pavattati dakkhiṇa asakūṭataḥ udaka dhārā pavattati
translated: a flame comes out of his left shoulder and water comes out of his right shoulder;🔽a flame comes out of his right shoulder and water comes out of his left shoulder;

original: dakkhiṇahatthato aggikkhandho pavattati, vāmahatthato udakadhārā pavattati;🔽vāmahatthato aggikkhandho pavattati, dakkhiṇahatthato udakadhārā pavattati;
analyzed: dakkhiṇa hatthataḥ aggi kkhandho pavattati vāma hatthataḥ udaka dhārā pavattati  vāma hatthataḥ aggi kkhandho pavattati dakkhiṇa hatthataḥ udaka dhārā pavattati
translated: a flame comes out of his right hand and water comes out of his left hand;🔽a flame comes out of his left hand and water comes out of his right hand;

original: dakkhiṇapassato aggikkhandho pavattati, vāmapassato udakadhārā pavattati;
analyzed: dakkhiṇa passataḥ aggi kkhandho pavattati vāma passataḥ udaka dhārā pavattati
translated: a flame comes out of his right side and water comes out of his left side;

original: vāmapassato aggikkhandho pavattati, dakkhiṇapassato udakadhārā pavattati;
analyzed: vāma passataḥ aggi kkhandho pavattati dakkhiṇa passataḥ udaka dhārā pavattati
translated: a mass of fire moves along his left side, and a stream of water moves along his right side;

original: dakkhiṇapādato aggikkhandho pavattati, vāmapādato udakadhārā pavattati;🔽vāmapādato aggikkhandho pavattati, dakkhiṇapādato udakadhārā pavattati;🔽aṅgulaṅgulehi aggikkhandho pavattati, aṅgulantarikāhi udakadhārā pavattati;
analyzed: dakkhiṇa pādataḥ aggi kkhandho pavattati vāma pādataḥ udaka dhārā pavattati  vāma pādataḥ aggi kkhandho pavattati dakkhiṇa pādataḥ udaka dhārā pavattati  aṅgula aṅgulehi aggi kkhandhaḥ pavattati aṅgula antarikāhi udaka dhārā pavattati
translated: a mass of fire moves along his right side, and a stream of water moves along his left side;🔽a mass of fire moves along his left side, and a stream of water moves along his right side;🔽a mass of fire moves along the tips of his fingers, and a stream of water moves along the spaces between his fingers;

original: aṅgulantarikāhi aggikkhandho pavattati, aṅgulaṅgulehi udakadhārā pavattati;
analyzed: aṅgula antarikāhi aggi kkhandhaḥ pavattati aṅgula aṅgulehi udaka dhārā pavattati
translated: a mass of fire moves along the spaces between his fingers, and a stream of water moves along the tips of his fingers;

original: ekekalomato aggikkhandho pavattati, ekekalomato udakadhārā pavattati;
analyzed: ekeka lomatas aggi kkhandho pavattati ekeka lomatas udaka dhārā pavattati
translated: a mass of fire moves along each individual hair, and a stream of water moves along each individual hair;

original: lomakūpato lomakūpato aggikkhandho pavattati, lomakūpato lomakūpato udakadhārā pavattati.🔽Channaṁ vaṇṇānaṁ—
analyzed: lomakūpataḥ lomakūpataḥ aggi kkhandho pavattati lomakūpataḥ lomakūpataḥ udaka dhārā pavattati  channam vaṇṇāna
translated: a mass of fire moves from pore to pore, and a stream of water moves from pore to pore.

original: nīlānaṁ, pītakānaṁ, lohitakānaṁ, odātānaṁ, mañjiṭṭhānaṁ, pabhassarānaṁ bhagavā caṅkamati, nimmito tiṭṭhati vā nisīdati vā seyyaṁ vā kappeti.
analyzed: nīlāna pītakāna lohitakāna odātāna mañjiṭṭhāna pabhassarānam bhagavā caṅkamati nimmitaḥ tiṭṭhati vā nisīdati vā seyyam vā kappeti
translated: The Blessed One walks up and down while the look-alike stands, sits, or lies down.

original: Bhagavā tiṭṭhati, nimmito caṅkamati vā nisīdati vā seyyaṁ vā kappeti.
analyzed: bhagavā tiṭṭhati nimmitaḥ caṅkamati vā nisīdati vā seyyam vā kappeti
translated: The Blessed One stands, the creation walks, sits down, or lies down.

original: Bhagavā nisīdati, nimmito caṅkamati vā tiṭṭhati vā seyyaṁ vā kappeti.🔽Bhagavā seyyaṁ kappeti, nimmito caṅkamati vā tiṭṭhati vā nisīdati vā.
analyzed: bhagavā nisīdati nimmitaḥ caṅkamati vā tiṭṭhati vā seyyam vā kappeti  bhagavā seyyam kappeti nimmitaḥ caṅkamati vā tiṭṭhati vā nisīdati vā
translated: The Blessed One sits down, the creation walks, stands, or lies down.🔽The Blessed One lies down, the creation walks, stands, or sits down.

original: Nimmito caṅkamati, bhagavā tiṭṭhati vā nisīdati vā seyyaṁ vā kappeti.🔽Nimmito tiṭṭhati, bhagavā caṅkamati vā nisīdati vā seyyaṁ vā kappeti.🔽Nimmito nisīdati, bhagavā caṅkamati vā tiṭṭhati vā seyyaṁ vā kappeti.
analyzed: nimmitaḥ caṅkamati bhagavā tiṭṭhati vā nisīdati vā seyyam vā kappeti  nimmito tiṭṭhati bhagavā caṅkamati vā nisīdati vā seyyam vā kappeti  nimmitaḥ nisīdati bhagavā caṅkamati vā tiṭṭhati vā seyyam vā kappeti
translated: The creation walks, the Blessed One stands, sits down, or lies down.🔽The creation stands, the Blessed One walks, sits down, or lies down.🔽The creation sits down, the Blessed One walks, stands, or lies down.

original: Nimmito seyyaṁ kappeti, bhagavā caṅkamati vā tiṭṭhati vā nisīdati vā.
analyzed: nimmitaḥ seyyam kappeti bhagavā caṅkamati vā tiṭṭhati vā nisīdati vā
translated: The creation lies down, the Blessed One walks, stands, or sits down.

analyzed: idam tathāgatassa yamaka pāṭihīre ñāṇa  yamaka pāṭihīra ñāṇa niddesaḥ sattatimaḥ
translated: This is the Tathagata’s knowledge of the miracle of double appearance.🔽The description of the knowledge of the miracle of double appearance is the seventieth chapter.
... The description of the knowledge of great compassion

analyzed: katamam tathāgatassa mahā karuṇā samāpattiyāḥ ñāṇa
translated: What is the Tathagata’s knowledge of the attainment of great compassion?🔽...

original: Bahukehi ākārehi passantānaṁ buddhānaṁ bhagavantānaṁ sattesu mahākaruṇā okkamati.
analyzed: bahukehi ākārehi passantānam buddhānam bhagavantānam sattesu mahā karuṇā okkamati
translated: The Great Compassion of the Buddhas arises in many ways as they see beings.

analyzed: ādittaḥ loka sannivāsaḥ iti
translated: The world is burning.

original: passantānaṁ buddhānaṁ bhagavantānaṁ sattesu mahākaruṇā okkamati.
analyzed: passantānam buddhānam bhagavantānam sattesu mahā karuṇā okkamati
translated: The Great Compassion of the Buddhas arises in many ways as they see beings.

analyzed: uyyuttaḥ loka sannivāsaḥ iti
translated: The world is engaged in the pursuit of pleasure.

original: passantānaṁ buddhānaṁ bhagavantānaṁ sattesu mahākaruṇā okkamati.
analyzed: passantānam buddhānam bhagavantānam sattesu mahā karuṇā okkamati
translated: The Great Compassion of the Buddhas arises in many ways as they see beings.

analyzed: payātaḥ loka sannivāsaḥ iti
translated: The world is rushing on.

original: passantānaṁ buddhānaṁ bhagavantānaṁ sattesu mahākaruṇā okkamati.
analyzed: passantānam buddhānam bhagavantānam sattesu mahā karuṇā okkamati
translated: The Great Compassion of the Buddhas arises in many ways as they see beings.

analyzed: kummagga paṭipannaḥ loka sannivāsaḥ ti
translated: The world is following a wrong path.

original: passantānaṁ buddhānaṁ bhagavantānaṁ sattesu mahākaruṇā okkamati.
analyzed: passantānam buddhānam bhagavantānam sattesu mahā karuṇā okkamati
translated: The Great Compassion of the Buddhas arises in many ways as they see beings.

analyzed: upanīyati lokaḥ
translated: The world is going to a place of suffering.

original: passantānaṁ buddhānaṁ bhagavantānaṁ sattesu mahākaruṇā okkamati.
analyzed: passantānam buddhānam bhagavantānam sattesu mahā karuṇā okkamati
translated: The Great Compassion of the Buddhas arises in many ways as they see beings.

analyzed: a tāṇaḥ lokaḥ an abhissaroti
translated: The world has no protector.

original: passantānaṁ buddhānaṁ bhagavantānaṁ sattesu mahākaruṇā okkamati.
analyzed: passantānam buddhānam bhagavantānam sattesu mahā karuṇā okkamati
translated: The Great Compassion of the Buddhas arises in many ways as they see beings.

analyzed: assakaḥ loko sabbam pahāya gamanīyanti
translated: The world is empty. Everything must be left behind and go.

original: passantānaṁ buddhānaṁ bhagavantānaṁ sattesu mahākaruṇā okkamati.
analyzed: passantānam buddhānam bhagavantānam sattesu mahā karuṇā okkamati
translated: When the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, see this, great compassion arises in them for beings.

analyzed: ūnaḥ lokaḥ a tittaḥ taṇhā dāsaḥ ti
translated: The world is incomplete, wanting, and thirsting, and is under the sway of craving.

original: passantānaṁ buddhānaṁ bhagavantānaṁ sattesu mahākaruṇā okkamati.
analyzed: passantānam buddhānam bhagavantānam sattesu mahā karuṇā okkamati
translated: When the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, see this, great compassion arises in them for beings.

analyzed: loka sannivāsaḥ iti  passantānam pe
translated: The world is a shelterless dwelling.🔽When the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, see this, great compassion arises in them for beings.

analyzed: aleṇaḥ loka sannivāsaḥ iti  passantānam pe
translated: The world is a cave dwelling.🔽When the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, see this, great compassion arises in them for beings.

analyzed: a saraṇaḥ loka sannivāsaḥ iti  passantānam pe
translated: The world is a refuge-less dwelling.🔽When the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, see this, great compassion arises in them for beings.

analyzed: a saraṇībhūtaḥ loka sannivāsaḥ iti  passantānam pe
translated: The world is a refuge-less place.🔽When the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, see this, great compassion arises in them for beings.

analyzed: uddhataḥ lokaḥ  passantānam pe
translated: The world is agitated and not calm.🔽When the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, see this, great compassion arises in them for beings.

original: sasallo lokasannivāso, viddho puthusallehi;🔽tassa natthañño koci sallānaṁ uddhatā, aññatra mayāti—
analyzed: sa sallaḥ loka sannivāsaḥ viddhaḥ puthusallehi  tassa na tthañño koci sallānam uddhatāḥ aññatra mayā ati
translated: The world is a dwelling place with enmity, pierced by manifold arrows.🔽There is no one else to pull out the arrows except me.

analyzed: passantānam pe
translated: When the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, see this, great compassion arises in them for beings.

original: avijjandhakārāvaraṇo lokasannivāso aṇḍabhūto kilesapañjarapakkhitto;🔽tassa natthañño koci ālokaṁ dassetā, aññatra mayāti—
analyzed: avijja andhakāra āvaraṇaḥ loka sannivāsaḥ aṇḍa bhūtaḥ kilesa pañjara pakkhitto  tassa koci ālokam aññatra mayā iti
translated: The world is a dwelling place covered by the darkness of ignorance, enclosed in a shell, caught in the cage of defilements.🔽There is no one else to show the light except me.

analyzed: passantānam pe
translated: When the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, see this, great compassion arises in them for beings.

analyzed: sabbaññuta ññāṇa  tattha āvaraṇam natthi iti
translated: This is knowledge of omniscience.🔽There is no obstruction here.

analyzed: an āvaraṇa ñāṇa  paccuppannam sabbam jānāti iti

analyzed: an āvaraṇa ñāṇa

original: Cakkhu ceva rūpā ca, evaṁ taṁ sabbaṁ jānātīti—🔽sabbaññutaññāṇaṁ.🔽Tattha āvaraṇaṁ natthīti—

analyzed: sabbaññuta ññāṇa  tattha āvaraṇam natthi iti
translated: This is knowledge of omniscience.🔽There is no obstruction here.

analyzed: an āvaraṇa ñāṇa
translated: This is unobstructed knowledge.

original: Yāvatā aniccaṭṭhaṁ dukkhaṭṭhaṁ anattaṭṭhaṁ, taṁ sabbaṁ jānātīti—

analyzed: sabbaññuta ññāṇa

analyzed: yāvatā cakkhussa pe  jarā maraṇassa anicca ṭṭham dukkha ṭṭham anatta ṭṭha tat sabbam jānāti iti

analyzed: tattha āvaraṇam natthi iti  an āvaraṇa ñāṇa

analyzed: yāvatā bhāvanāya bhāvanaṭṭham pe

analyzed: tattha āvaraṇam natthi iti

analyzed: an āvaraṇa ñāṇa

analyzed: yāvatā khandhānam tam sabbam jānāti iti

analyzed: tattha āvaraṇam natthi iti

analyzed: yāvatā saṅkhatānam saṅkhataṭṭham pe

analyzed: tattha āvaraṇam natthi iti

analyzed: an āvaraṇa ñāṇa
translated: This is knowledge without obstruction.

analyzed: yāvatā kusale dhamme sabbam jānāti iti

analyzed: tattha āvaraṇam natthi iti

analyzed: yāvatā a byākate dhamme  yāvatā kāmāvacare dhamme

analyzed: yāvatā rūpāvacare dhamme

analyzed: yāvatā arūpāvacare dhamme

analyzed: yāvatā a pariyāpanne dhamme sabbam jānāti iti

analyzed: sabbaññuta ññāṇa
translated: this is knowledge of all.

analyzed: tattha āvaraṇam natthi iti
translated: There is no obstruction here:

analyzed: an āvaraṇa ñāṇa

original: Yāvatā dukkhassa dukkhaṭṭhaṁ, taṁ sabbaṁ jānātīti—

analyzed: tattha āvaraṇam natthi iti

analyzed: yāvatā samudayassa samudaya ṭṭham pe

analyzed: yāvatā nirodhassa nirodha ṭṭham pe

analyzed: sabbaññuta ññāṇa

analyzed: tattha āvaraṇam natthi iti
translated: There is no obstruction here:

analyzed: an āvaraṇa ñāṇa

original: Yāvatā atthapaṭisambhidāya atthapaṭisambhidaṭṭhaṁ, taṁ sabbaṁ jānātīti—
analyzed: yāvatā attha paṭisambhidāya tam sabbam jānāti iti

analyzed: sabbaññuta ññāṇa

analyzed: tattha āvaraṇam natthi iti
translated: There is no obstruction here:

analyzed: yāvatā nirutti paṭisambhidāya nirutti paṭisambhida ṭṭham pe
translated: As far as there is the state of the discernment of language in the discernment of language …

original: yāvatā paṭibhānapaṭisambhidāya paṭibhānapaṭisambhidaṭṭhaṁ, taṁ sabbaṁ jānātīti—
analyzed: yāvatā paṭibhāna paṭisambhidāya tat sabbam jānāti iti
translated: He knows all that is to be known about the discrimination of perspicuity.

analyzed: sabbaññuta ññāṇa  tattha āvaraṇam natthi iti
translated: This is knowledge of all.🔽There is no obstruction here.

analyzed: an āvaraṇa ñāṇa  yāvatā tam sabbam jānāti iti
translated: This is unobstructed knowledge.🔽He knows all that is to be known about the knowledge of the differences in the faculties of other beings.

analyzed: sabbaññuta ññāṇa  tattha āvaraṇam natthi iti
translated: This is knowledge of all.🔽There is no obstruction here.

analyzed: an āvaraṇa ñāṇa
translated: This is unobstructed knowledge.

analyzed: yāvatā āsaya anusaye ñāṇam pe
translated: He knows all that is to be known about the inclinations and underlying tendencies of beings. …

analyzed: yāvatā yamaka pāṭihīre ñāṇam pe
translated: He knows all that is to be known about the twin miracle. …

original: yāvatā mahākaruṇāsamāpattiyā ñāṇaṁ, taṁ sabbaṁ jānātīti—
analyzed: yāvatā mahā karuṇā samāpattiyāḥ ñāṇa tat sabbam jānāti iti
translated: He knows all that is to be known about the attainment of great compassion.

analyzed: sabbaññuta ññāṇa  tattha āvaraṇam natthi iti
translated: This is knowledge of all.🔽There is no obstruction here.

analyzed: an āvaraṇa ñāṇa
translated: This is unobstructed knowledge.

original: Yāvatā sadevakassa lokassa samārakassa sabrahmakassa sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya🔽diṭṭhaṁ sutaṁ mutaṁ viññātaṁ pattaṁ pariyesitaṁ anuvicaritaṁ manasā, taṁ sabbaṁ jānātīti—
analyzed: yāvatā sa devakassa lokassa sa mārakassa sa brahmakassa sa ssamaṇa brāhmaṇiyā pajāya sa deva manussāya  diṭṭham sutam mutam viññātam pattam pariyesitam anuvicaritam manasā tam sabbam jānāti iti
translated: He knows all that is to be known about the world with its gods, its Māras, and its Brahmās, about this generation with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans,🔽what is seen, heard, sensed, cognized, reached, sought after, examined by the mind—all that he knows.

analyzed: sabbaññuta ññāṇa  tattha āvaraṇam natthi iti
translated: This is knowledge of all.🔽There is no obstruction here.

analyzed: an āvaraṇa ñāṇa
translated: This is unobstructed knowledge.

analyzed: na tassa addiṭṭham idhatthi kiñci  atho a viññātam a jānitabba
translated: Nor anything that he does not know.

analyzed: sabbam abhiññāsi yat atthi na iyya
translated: He has directly known all that is to be known,

analyzed: tathāgato tena
translated: So the Enlightened One is the All-Seeing One.

analyzed: samanta cakkhu iti kenaṭṭhena samanta cakkhu
translated: Why is he called the All-Seeing One?

analyzed: cuddasa buddha ñāṇāni
translated: There are fourteen kinds of knowledge of the Enlightened One:

original: Dukkhe ñāṇaṁ buddhañāṇaṁ, dukkhasamudaye ñāṇaṁ buddhañāṇaṁ, dukkhanirodhe ñāṇaṁ buddhañāṇaṁ,
analyzed: dukkhe ñāṇam buddha ñāṇa dukkha samudaye ñāṇam buddha ñāṇa dukkha nirodhe ñāṇam buddha ñāṇa
translated: Knowledge of suffering is knowledge of the Enlightened One; knowledge of the origin of suffering is knowledge of the Enlightened One; knowledge of the cessation of suffering is knowledge of the Enlightened One;

original: dukkhanirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya ñāṇaṁ buddhañāṇaṁ, atthapaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ buddhañāṇaṁ,🔽dhammapaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ buddhañāṇaṁ, niruttipaṭisambhide ñāṇaṁ buddhañāṇaṁ, paṭibhānapaṭisambhide
analyzed: dukkha nirodha gāminiyā paṭipadāya ñāṇam buddha ñāṇa attha paṭisambhide ñāṇam buddha ñāṇa  dhamma paṭisambhide ñāṇam buddha ñāṇa nirutti paṭisambhide ñāṇam buddha ñāṇa paṭibhāna paṭisambhide
translated: knowledge of the way leading to the cessation of suffering is knowledge of the Enlightened One; knowledge of the discernment of meaning is knowledge of the Enlightened One;🔽knowledge of the discernment of truth is knowledge of the Enlightened One; knowledge of the discernment of language is knowledge of the Enlightened One; knowledge of the discernment of perspicuity is knowledge of the Enlightened One;

original: ñāṇaṁ buddhañāṇaṁ, indriyaparopariyattañāṇaṁ buddhañāṇaṁ, sattānaṁ āsayānusaye ñāṇaṁ
analyzed: ñāṇam buddha ñāṇaḥ indriya para upari yatta ñāṇam buddha ñāṇa
translated: knowledge of the higher and lower faculties of others is knowledge of the Enlightened One; knowledge of the underlying tendencies of beings is knowledge of the Enlightened One;

original: buddhañāṇaṁ, yamakapāṭihīre ñāṇaṁ buddhañāṇaṁ, mahākaruṇāsamāpattiyā ñāṇaṁ buddhañāṇaṁ,
analyzed: buddha ñāṇa yamaka pāṭihīre ñāṇam buddha ñāṇa mahā karuṇā samāpattiyāḥ ñāṇam buddha ñāṇa
translated: knowledge of the twin miracle is knowledge of the Enlightened One; knowledge of the attainment of great compassion is knowledge of the Enlightened One;

analyzed: sabbaññuta ññāṇam buddha ñāṇa anāvaraṇa ñāṇam buddha ñāṇa
translated: The knowledge of the one with omniscience is the knowledge of the Buddha. The knowledge with no obstructions is the knowledge of the Buddha.

analyzed: imāni cuddasa buddha ñāṇāni
translated: These are the fourteen kinds of knowledge of the Buddha.

original: Imesaṁ cuddasannaṁ buddhañāṇānaṁ aṭṭha ñāṇāni sāvakasādhāraṇāni;
analyzed: imesam cuddasannam buddha ñāṇānam aṭṭha ñāṇāni sāvaka sādhāraṇāni
translated: Eight of these kinds of knowledge are shared with disciples,

analyzed: cha ñāṇāni asādhāraṇāni sāvakehi
translated: while six are not shared.

analyzed: yāvatā dukkhassa dukkhaṭṭhaḥ sabbaḥ ñāto
translated: The extent of the suffering of suffering is known.

analyzed: aññātaḥ dukkhaṭṭho natthi iti
translated: There is no extent of suffering that is not known.

analyzed: sabbaññuta ññāṇa  tattha āvaraṇam natthi iti
translated: This is the knowledge of the one with omniscience.🔽There are no obstructions there.

analyzed: an āvaraṇa ñāṇa
translated: This is the knowledge with no obstructions.

original: Yāvatā dukkhassa dukkhaṭṭho, sabbo ñāto, sabbo diṭṭho, sabbo vidito, sabbo sacchikato, sabbo phassito paññāya;
analyzed: yāvatā dukkhassa dukkhaṭṭho sabbaḥ ñātaḥ sabbaḥ diṭṭhaḥ sabbaḥ vidito sabbaḥ sacchikato sabbaḥ phassito paññāya
translated: The extent of the suffering of suffering is known, seen, discerned, realized, and experienced with wisdom.

analyzed: a phassito paññāya dukkhaṭṭhaḥ natthi iti
translated: There is no extent of suffering that is not experienced with wisdom.

analyzed: sabbaññuta ññāṇa  tattha āvaraṇam natthi iti
translated: This is the knowledge of the one with omniscience.🔽There are no obstructions there.

analyzed: an āvaraṇa ñāṇa  yāvatā samudayassa samudaya ṭṭhaḥ
translated: This is the knowledge with no obstructions.🔽The extent of the origin of suffering …

analyzed: yāvatā nirodhassa nirodha ṭṭhaḥ
translated: The extent of the cessation of suffering …

analyzed: yāvatā maggassa maggaṭṭhaḥ pe
translated: The extent of the path to the cessation of suffering …

analyzed: yāvatā attha paṭisambhidāya attha paṭisambhidaṭṭhaḥ
translated: The extent of the discrimination of meaning …

analyzed: yāvatā dhamma paṭisambhidāya dhamma paṭisambhidaṭṭhaḥ  yāvatā nirutti paṭisambhidāya nirutti paṭisambhida ṭṭhaḥ
translated: As far as the discrimination of meaning extends, the discrimination of meaning is known, seen, understood, realized, and contacted with wisdom.🔽As far as the discrimination of language extends, the discrimination of language is known, seen, understood, realized, and contacted with wisdom.

original: yāvatā paṭibhānapaṭisambhidāya paṭibhānapaṭisambhidaṭṭho, sabbo ñāto, sabbo diṭṭho, sabbo vidito, sabbo sacchikato, sabbo phassito paññāya;🔽aphassito paññāya paṭibhānapaṭisambhidaṭṭho natthīti—
analyzed: yāvatā paṭibhāna paṭisambhidāya paṭibhāna paṭisambhidaṭṭho sabbaḥ ñātaḥ sabbaḥ diṭṭhaḥ sabbaḥ vidito sabbaḥ sacchikato sabbaḥ phassito paññāya  a phassito paññāya paṭibhāna paṭisambhidā daṭṭho natthi iti
translated: As far as the discrimination of inspired speech extends, the discrimination of inspired speech is known, seen, understood, realized, and contacted with wisdom.

analyzed: sabbaññuta ññāṇa
translated: There is nothing that is not known, seen, understood, realized, and contacted with wisdom as the discrimination of inspired speech.🔽This is knowledge of omniscience.

analyzed: tattha āvaraṇam natthi iti
translated: There is nothing that is an obstruction here.

analyzed: an āvaraṇa ñāṇa  yāvatā
translated: This is knowledge free from obstruction.🔽As far as knowledge of the higher and lower faculties of others extends …

analyzed: yāvatā āsaya anusaye ñāṇam
translated: as far as knowledge of the underlying tendencies of beings extends …

analyzed: yāvatā yamaka pāṭihīre ñāṇam
translated: as far as knowledge of the twin miracle extends …

analyzed: yāvatā mahā karuṇā samāpattiyāḥ
translated: as far as knowledge of the attainment of great compassion extends;

original: sabbaṁ ñātaṁ, sabbaṁ diṭṭhaṁ, sabbaṁ viditaṁ, sabbaṁ sacchikataṁ, sabbaṁ phassitaṁ paññāya;
analyzed: sabbam ñāta sabbam diṭṭha sabbam vidita sabbam sacchikata sabbam phassitam paññāya
translated: everything is known, seen, understood, realized, and contacted with wisdom.

analyzed: a phassitam paññāya mahā karuṇā samāpattiyāḥ ñāṇam natthi iti
translated: There is nothing that is not known, seen, understood, realized, and contacted with wisdom as the attainment of great compassion.

analyzed: sabbaññuta ññāṇa
translated: This is knowledge of omniscience.

analyzed: tattha āvaraṇam natthi iti
translated: There is nothing that is an obstruction here.

analyzed: an āvaraṇa ñāṇa
translated: It is knowledge without obstruction.🔽As far as the world with its gods,

original: Yāvatā sadevakassa lokassa samārakassa sabrahmakassa sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya
analyzed: yāvatā sa devakassa lokassa sa mārakassa sa brahmakassa sa ssamaṇa brāhmaṇiyā pajāya sa deva manussāya
translated: with its Māras, with its Brahmās, with its contemplatives and brahmans, with its gods and humans,

original: diṭṭhaṁ sutaṁ mutaṁ viññātaṁ pattaṁ pariyesitaṁ anuvicaritaṁ manasā, sabbaṁ ñātaṁ,
analyzed: diṭṭham sutam mutam viññātam pattam pariyesitam anuvicaritam manasā sabbam ñāta
translated: is known, seen, heard, or understood, reached by way of mental intention,🔽all is known,

original: sabbaṁ diṭṭhaṁ, sabbaṁ viditaṁ, sabbaṁ sacchikataṁ, sabbaṁ phassitaṁ paññāya;
analyzed: sabbam diṭṭha sabbam vidita sabbam sacchikata sabbam phassitam paññāya
translated: all is seen, all is discerned, all is realized, all is contacted with wisdom;

analyzed: a phassitam paññāya na atthi iti
translated: what is not contacted with wisdom does not exist.

analyzed: sabbaññuta ññāṇa
translated: It is knowledge of omniscience.

analyzed: tattha āvaraṇam natthi iti
translated: There is no obstruction here.

analyzed: an āvaraṇa ñāṇa
translated: It is knowledge without obstruction.

analyzed: na tassa addiṭṭham idhatthi kiñci  atho a viññātam a jānitabba
translated: There is nothing not seen in the world,🔽nor anything not known or not discerned.

analyzed: sabbam abhiññāsi yat atthi na iyya
translated: The Omniscient One has directly known all that is to be known,

analyzed: tathāgato tena
translated: and is therefore the All-Seeing One.

analyzed: ñāṇa kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The discussion of knowledge is finished.
